text: Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a hazy amber colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of orange, some grapefruit, subtle bready malts and slight spicy hops. Taste of bready malts, caramel, a little toasted malts, some orange, slight grapefruit and subtle spicy hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, spicy hop bitterness in the finish. A bitter with mainly spicy hops but with lots of malt and subtle citrus. Good but quite highly carbonated.

0,33l Flasche. Orange-kupferfarbenes klares Bier. Heller luftiger Schaum. Erdbeer und Hopfen Duft. Etwas Karamel. Bitterer Antrunk. Kräuter, Erdbeere, Malz. Leider etwas wässerig, aber für 4,5% ganz ok. Langes bitteres Finish.

Flaska. Disig bärnstensfärgad med ett gräddigt och bestående smutsvitt skum. Dofter av citrus, karamell och gräs. Smakinslag av citrus, toffee, mogna krusbär och vitt bröd. Medelbeska. Lätt syrlig avslutning.
A me questa mi è garbata, come aperitivo è stato rinfrescante e molto stuzzicante, bona...

Delicious. Pours deep orange with a decent off-white head. Lots of citrus and spice in the nose; well-balanced hoppiness and a rounded body. Moving in the direction of a lighter IPA. Great summer brew.

Bottle at cool bar in Groningen. Blown away by the aroma and f,a four of this beer. So glad I put my trust in de molen for this one. So much flavour, powerful bitterness that is quite scrumptious. Yummy.
Lekkie, bardzo pijalne, czuć karmelowość. Na dnie butelki trochę osadu drożdżowego. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.

Poco aroma a lupulo.
Buen aspecto, espuma persistente.
Cuerpo medio.bajo.
Balanceada aunque un poco plana en boca

Ambar, espuma muy abundante y duradera. Aroma interesante, azúcar tostada, mango, notas herbales. Excelente en boca, equilibrada. Caramelo, con indudable base malteada. Contrapunto lupulado, frutal, uva, mango y pomelo. Perfecta de gas. Enorme cuerpo para el bajo alcohol que tiene. Grande.

330ml bottled served in Brouwerij De Molen tasteing glass. 

Tropical smell, aroma is hoppy-citrus, grapefruit, lime, light amber color.
En fin smag, en god bitterhed uden det går helt over i en ipa. Ikke meget sødme .
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, citus, fruit, hops and a bitter finish.

330ml bottle served in regular glass. Purchased at Drinks of the World - Geneva.
A: Pours a cloudy amber color forming a huge and creamy light beige head. Good retention and lots of lacings formed and left in the glass.
S: Caramel malts, grapefruit, flowery, grassy and resinous hops.
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of caramel and crystal malts. Notes of grapefruit and grassy hops. Resin. Medium bitterness. Earthy hops.
M: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Crispy aftertaste.
O: Great drinkability. Great bitter.

0,33l bottle from K-Supermarket Lansivayla, Jyvaskyla. Pours hazy yellow colour with some head. Quite fruity, hoppy and malty aroma, slight caramelness as well, moderately bitter, lively carbonation. Light to medium body.

Cloudy amber pour with a white head. Really bland aroma on this. A bit of bready malt, some toast, and a hint of floral and citrus peel hops. There are some grass notes and floral hops on the palate with a hint of citrus peel bitterness. Very light malt sweetness of toasted bread.

Smell- wood, citrus hoppy, fruity. Smells like beer
Look- White head, cloudy mid dark orange colour. Looks like beer
Taste- mild bitter yet metallic, sticks to top of mouth, hints of lemon. After taste longer dryer more bitter. Tastes like beer. 
Over all - nice beer. Would drink again

Robe orange foncée avec une mousse Blanc cassé qui se tient. Le nez est houblonné et fruité aux arômes pamplemousse/citron. En bouche on a une bonne attaque pétillante, le houblon est bien présent, on a les arômes du nez, un petit côté très légèrement herbacé et une finale amère intéressante le tout très bien équilibré.

Bottle, thanks to fajry. Hazy orange golden colour. Bubbly white head, quickly falling. Aroma is of hops, flowery, earthy, grapefruit, Sligthly oxidized. Bisquity maltiness. Taste same. Quite watery. Not Bad.

Bottle from the craft beer advent calendar courtesy of Pix. Cheers! Hazy golden with a big frothy white head. Slightly metallic malty citrus aroma. The taste has pleasant citrus with biscuity malt and spice with a mild bitter finish. Decent bitter.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Blonde claire, bien typée bitter. Faible corpulence, belle amertume, fine bulle. Ensemble cool sans plus.
Along with Yves at my home hazy amber coloured body with a white head and a spicy hop fruity aroma a hops spicy sweet dry bitter taste with a bitter finish
Shared with wim at his home. Hazy amber colored beer with medium white head and no carbonation. Hopped spicy aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped fruited sweet.

Aug. 16. A 0.33 l bottle that poured a lightly hazy amber to copper body with a bigger head. Interesting fruity aroma, lightly sweet like fictive sweet rose-lemon drops. My version was bittered with Sladek, late hop Amarillo, first time I encounter the former I believe. Flavor was only lightly bitter with herbal and perfume hops while transition in palette of flavors was smooth to licorice and that dry sugary biscuit so common in these beers. Pretty high carbonation within its medium body. Moderately long finish, dry papery biscuit dominated. De Molen guarantees atypical but awesome takes on styles and this is one of them for sure!
Combination of malty, spicy and (tropical) fruity flavors. Well balanced, good mouthfeel and a nice bitterness. A good beer.

Pours a hazy yellow-amber with a big white bubbly head that leaves a small lacing. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy with lemon and lime notes. Some grass and wheat hints. Not bad, soft and simple. Taste is mildly bitter, again with lemony flavors, some herbs and grasses. Well done but not so remarkable. Light bodied, a bit fizzy carbonation. Good bitter, nothing exciting.
Aroma: hops and fruits. Hazy amber with medium head. Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sour. Bitter finish.

Tomada en el Kraken.

De molen pocas veces defrauda.
Cerveza facil de beber.
Color pajizo. Espuma blanca.
Ligeramente lupulada.
Agradable.
Para beber y beber

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Op & Top by Brouwerij De Molen at Kufle i KapsleLekkie, o dziwo slodkawe i cytrusowe, smakuje bardziej jak apa a nie bitter, wysoka pijalnoscOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Piwo jest ewidentnie przegazowane. Aromat chmielowy, cytrusowy, taki w sumie niezbyt rześki. Z drugiej strony, po ogrzaniu wychodzą fajne owoce tropikalne, pomarańcze. W smaku jest przyjemnie owocowe. Przy 9 plato kompletnie nie jest wodniste, a słodowość jest nawet lekko zaznaczona, bardzo fajnie. Goryczki nie brakuje, a nawet lekko zalega. Mocno owocowy finisz. Wysycenie oczywiście wysokie, ale raczej nie przeszkadza. Ciekawe, smaczne.

Bottled 16/12/14, now two months before its bbd-date; whats left, after almost two years of unknown storage conditions: aromas of caramel malts, honey, chamomile and marguerites. Quite a low carbonation with a slightly watery palate, subtle malt and caramel flavours and a subdued bitterness.
Trübes Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, etwas Karamell, fruchtig, Zitrusfrüchte, kräuterig, würzig.
Bardzo miły bitter, mocno nachmielny, niesamowicie treściwy jak na 9 PLATO.
Tasted from the tap on the 27/09/2016. Light amber colour with a low lingering white head. Aroma of grass, hopsand bread. Taste is grassy and hoppy with a dry finish. Next one please!

Bottle 33cl. Yellow, orange with a huge fluffy off white head. Aroma of dry hops and malts, citrus peels. The taste is mildly bitter, somewhat dry. Refreshing. The aftertaste is bitter, a bit flat. Good though.

Appearance: Amber, slightly hazy. Nice white head.
Aroma: Hops, light fruits.
Taste: First and foremost hops. Lingering bitterness. Slight citrus? Not much else interesting.
Bought: Craft Gallery, 330 ml, CHF 3.90
Info: 17/9-2016, BB: 12/10-2017
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber color, white head. Aroma is citrusy, caramel, Amarillo hops. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, caramel, malt, citrusy, grapefruit zest, hoppy finish.
.33l bottle from k market Westway. Pours cloudy amber with high foamy head. Aroma is pine and malts, citru fruits and hint of caramel. Flavor is mostly same with grape fruit. Nice!
Fresh and inviting smell. Foam looks a bit like dried up foam by the sea. Grapefruit. Lemon zest. Bitterness is present, but not over the top luckily.

Der Geruch würzig und amerikanisch fruity. Der Trunk ALEig und kaum mit Kohlensäure geflutet. Dezent bitter und da relativ wenig Alkohol im Spiel ist, kann man sagen: SEHR gelungen. Preis/Leistungsverhältnis stimm,t bei 1,50 Euro die 0,33 Flasche, ebenfalls. Direkt von der DE MOLEN Brauerei.
Aroma has citrus, spruce and hops. Hazy, amber color, rocky head. Nice bitter taste, fizzy carbonation, long finish. Very pleasant and refreshing beer.

Oranssinkeltainen, utuinen olut paksulla vaahdolla. Tuoksussa sitrusta ja hedelmää, maku hedelmäinen sekä samalla sitruksisen katkera. Sopiva runko, ei missään nimessä liian köykäinen. Hieno maitokauppaolut ja voisi toimia kesäkeleillä.
Nevelig goudbruin met medium witte kraag die snel wegtrekt. Citrushop, mandarijn, gist. Bitter. Licht melig, volle body. Lekker.

Shinny clear golden orange with golden hues and a small but creamy and beatiful white head. Aroma is gentle orange with some tangerine. Flavor is fruity with same citrus plus some peachy notes, and a decent malt backbone for the low ABV. Light to medium palate. Refreshing, drinkable yet full of flavor.

Bottle. Amber body with white head. Aroma is nice fruity with almonds and hints of caramel. Taste is nice herbal and malty. Mouthfeel is typical for the low alcohol. Aftertaste is nice bitter with some malty sweetness

Strong, fine carbonation, taste of grapefruit, bitter orange, quite bitter but not in an annoying way. Hazy, dark orange appearance with firm head. Long, bitter aftertaste. Surprisingly not very hoppy. Taste a bit like a bitter IPA. All in all very nice and not too expensive.
Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Pours unclear amber with white head. Fruity hoppy aroma, citrus, yeast, light bodied, very drinkable. Bitter finish. Nice one.

Cloud orange, stable white head.

Aroma: grapefruit peel, grass, white grape, subtle hops.
Taste: bitter with light tartness.
Flavour: malt, toffee, citrus pell, grape, berries, some spicy yeasty notes.

Good.
33cl bottle. Hazy amber with a fluffy white head. Sweet caramel aroma, taste is caramel and bitter orange. Dry finish

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Cloudy yellow-straw coloured with a toffee, malty, orange and zesty fruity flavour followed by a smooth pine, herbal and fruity finish. Very good, especially for the low ABV.
Sladek/Amarillo combo for me. Misty reddish amber body. Berry aroma, creamy, fruity maltiness. Similar in the taste, with a lasting light bitterness. Quite OK.
Ottima bitter. Colore biondo appena torbido, leggera schiuma bianca. Aroma molto buono amaro ed erbaceo. Bella amarezza e frizzantina,finisce secca.

Etwas enttäuschend. 
Sehr wenig Hopfengeschmack, nahezu ausschließlich Bittere. Im Aroma dafür aber schön fruchtig.
0.33l bottle. Hazy orange body, thick off-white head. Aroma of caramel, honey and citrusy hops. Taste of caramel, honey, toast, peach and citrusy hops. Nice session IPA.

Light floral hops, grass, pale grain malts. Hazy gold, massive, creamy, off-white head. Medium bitter. Light citrus fruits, lemon, floral hops, grassy bitterness intensifies, soft carbonation, very bitter finish. OK Bitter, well-balanced, a touch too fizzy and maybe bitter, could do with more complexity. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

0,33l bottle out of Craftbeer Calendar. Refreshing bitterness. Good.

Bottle in Seattle, via Vlada in Belgrade. Creamy off white foam, medium dark orange. Medium spiced citrus aroma, body is much more metallic malt. Within the best by but no fresh hop flavors whatsoever. Sweet metallic notes on bready malt. A bit of metallic bitter at finish.
2.60 Mousse très aérée (verre tulipe), nez floral, couleur ambrée clair. Bonne amertume, arrière goût persistant

Nice bitter. Very refreshing and citrusy but also nice malt aroma, with bread and toffee coming out. Flavour lacks a certain kick but is nice. Hops aromas come through nicely and the caramel malt gives it a very nice touch. Dry and bitter finish. Nice one but lacks intensity which makes it a bit too watery for me. Very drinkable though.

Light amber, low lingering head. Aroma citrus and mellon with bit of bread crumb. Palate medium, low carbonation. Taste tangerine, white grapes. Dry finish. Lasting bitterness. A great session choice, but nothing special really.

Cobreada, límpida. Espuma clara, fina, abundante, de média duração. Aroma resinoso, cítrico, com notas de casca de laranja, damasco, laranja e pinho. Sabor amargo persistente que passa por um forte toque de resina. Corpo leve. Acidez baixa.
33cl bottle: Bright orange color. Fruity and resinous hops in the aroma, banana fruit esters really come through on the palate, bitter-sweet finish. Fantastic and well-balanced.

330ml bottle from Beer52.com (£1.62 aprrox.):
Really interesting stuff from De Molen with good bitterness, hops & caramel opening things up; its definitely a sweet on for the style too. Theres a strong American influence with citrus hops, some pine & the odd tropical fruit. The balance was good & its definitely one that Id have again.

Flavours of sweet toasted malt, biscuit, floral hops and citrus fruits. Pretty smooth bitter and hoppy pale ale. Refreshing.

Pour is amber with a thin head, aroma is sweet, fruity. Taste is light fruity, spruce, faint bitterness, a bit watery. Decent

(bottle, Vrutak, Zagreb)
Drank 12-3-16 in Cafe Moenen with my father and sister after the Dennett lecture at De Vereeniging. Not bad for such a low ABV beer. Pretty well hopped. Fresh as well.

Une bonne bitter.

Bottled 330ml. -at Pivoteka Zagreb. Darker golden coloured, small white head, hops and whiff of honey in the nose. Moderate malty, strong fruity hoppy, touch of honey and caramel with rather bitter finish. Nothing more nothing less than ok.

Hazy orange body. Three fingers of white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruits, pine, litchi. Flavours of pine, citrus, grapefruits, litchi. Some caramel notes. Strong bitter backbone. Medium piney and citrusy finish, fairly bitter and slightly dry.

Puuttuu häpiend. Perus lutkutes. Hyvä jälkimaku, mutta ei kuitenkaan paljon enempää. Ok.

330 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange colour with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and caramel. Medium body and carbonation with bitter taste. Nice and refreshing.
Bottle from The Real Ale Store, Newark. Golden colour with a big white head. Fruity and pine hop aroma. Taste mid bitter. Lively body.
Golden amber color with nice head. Aroma is hops, citrus. Flavor is malt, hops, bitter.

Bottle from Albert Heijn in Leerdam. The beer is deep golden to amber colored and has a large and stable white head, with average carbonation. 
The aroma is fruity (grapefruits, tropical), grassy and in the background a nice caramel sweetness.
The taste is light bodied and hoppy with nice notes of citrus and flowers. After a while the sweetness of the caramel is noticable.
The finish is pretty short with a light sourness and bitterness.

0.33 bottle from Hoppiness, Koper, Slovenia, shared with lovely Anja. Murky orange with medium creamy diminishing off white head with heavy lacing. Medium hopped with Amarillo, zest, orange peel, tropical notes. Body is thin as expected, but I expected some more bitterness, this is rather empty. Medium carbonation. Aromatic, light and drinkable, but could have more character.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Amber color with off-white head. Aroma has a lot of aromatic hops reminding me of white grapes and herbs. Taste starts also fruity with grapes, green tea and the same herbal note from the aroma. Popping bitterness but not too strong. Body is light, making the beer very easy to drink. Really good one overall.

11.2 oz bottle poured. This beer was a foam explosion. Ended up being about a 10 oz pour as a result. This bottle is a little past its prime, bottled on 04/16/2013. Since I missed the two year mark I will be sure to rerate this if I get the chance, but still tastes fresh to me. Smooth, rich caramel malts. Earthy hop aroma. Lingering balanced caramel malt and earthy hop finish. Unique to my usual beers, and very enjoyable.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A brown opaque beer with a medium white head ; poor retention. Landscape of fruits (citrus, orange), resin, herb and biscuit (+). Light to medium sweet, light to medium dry bitter refreshing, light warming background. Light to medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation, sweet and warming finish, herbal note. Overall, a pleasant fruity bittersweet beer ; watery texture, light carbonation.

Maker: Brouwerij de Molen, Bodegraven, The Netherlands ***
Beer: De Molen Op & Top (bottled, unfiltered, 330ml) ***
Style: Bitter (?!) ***
ALC.VOL.: 4.5% ***

"9° Plato, 30.4 EBU, bittering hops Premiant, as late hops Cascade and Amarillo." [brewery note] ***

Colour: Deep hazy orange, with a small, fluffy off-white head. ***
Nose: Zitrus, pine, herbs. ***
Texture: Light to medium body. Watery. Active carbonation. ***
Taste: Pinewood is strong at first, with a dry, mildly sour citrusy note floral hops and some mild chewy malts in the background. Middle is drier still, with some resin, muted fruitiness. Bitterness increases towards the end, which otherwise is dry as before. Floral hops and malts in the after taste. ***

Impressions: Supposedly this is a Dutch interpretation of the English bitter style (the label says "American bitter-ish"). I find few connections, except in the after taste. Otherwise it strikes me as being closer to some Belgian ales. Very dry, not very fruity (as a result), and a little too fizzy/overly carbonated (and that couldnt be further from an English Bitter).

Hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma of caramel, grapefruit, grain, piney hops, yeast. Dry and lightly sweet taste with mild hoppy bitterness in finish and state. Light to medium body and average carbonation. Quite drinkable.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. A bit soapy in aroma, but also some lemons. Due to the soap that makes it smell like your dish cleaner... Quite dry and a bit watery, but the bitterness is well crafted with the nice taste.

Bottle at the Belgrade Beer Fest in Serbia. Pours a very cloudy deep golcen color, tick off-white cap. Nose: lemon skin, citric, De Molen character. Mouth: toasted malts, medium-low carbonation, floral notes, fresh feel. Mild but pungent bitterness. Nice beer.

2012 bottling, so a bit beyond the two year recommended drink fate. Very carbonated pour, thick of white head, hazy light copper color. Bitter nose hint of lemon. Blend oh hops, early in the mouth, finished with somewhat pine hops. Solid bitter.

La Op & Top est une bière de type Bitter anglaise brassée par les hollandais de De Molen. Elle puise son originalité de ses houblons américains, notamment le Cascade et l’Amarillo. Plutôt légère puisque titrant à 4,50%, cette bière présente un profil aromatique tout à fait étonnant pour ce style de bière !
Cette bière hollandaise se pare d’une robe très légèrement ambrée et aux superbes reflets orangés. Le tout est surmonté d’une abondante mousse blanche. Le nez nous dévoile des arômes de pèche, d’agrumes et de caramel tandis que la bouche fine et légère apparaît très fruitée. La fin de bouche se veut sèche et relativement amère.

Draft. Gold in colour with medium carbonation. Not an overly aromatic beer, but some faint pale malt and Amarillo hop (sour peach candy) notes are there. Flavors are a blend of spicy Belgian yeast, Belgian cara malts, and orchard fruit. Lighter bodied than expected. More like a Belgian Pale than a Bitter in my estimation.

September 9, 2014 - on draught at Old Fountain. Such an oddball beer - what a find; a "Belgian hoppy bitter" - and yup, thats this one all right. Hazy amber with a lovely creamy tan/beige lasting head - lots of sticky lace. Has that unmistakable Belgian yeast character (sharp, floral, sweet, loaded with esters), cereal grain and fresh pungent floral bitterness - maybe not quite balanced, but interesting as hell (8-). Taste follows - less malt sweetness, just slightly raw graininess, extra bitterness, a little cat and resin which was not in the aroma - an oddball. Chewy, slightly light body, very very airy on the palate, with only a medium pungently floral finish - not all that aggressive, and impressively "not sweet" - I will have this again.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2015 Nice almost clear golden orange with an excellent white top. Wonderful mixture of US , UK and Belgian tradition. Extraordinary earthy bitter. Piny hops, grain, hay, citrus and apricot caramel. Could be a little bit stronger in alcohol, but anyway. Moderate body. Fresh and drinkable.. .

Bottle. Hazy orange pour with tan head. Citrusy hopped aromas, pretty one dimensional. Crisp and light buttering of citrus tones, hops at the core.
Great bitter beer, with lots of one De Molens favorite hops: Amarillo. One of my favorites as well, so I loved it.

33cl bottle at big De Molen Tasting at De Kelk, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: citrus, hoppy, fruity, bitter.
TASTE: bitter aftertaste, pleasant, nice and fruity.
IPA légère, pas trop amère, très fraîche et rafraîchissante, sur les agrumes et les fruits exotiques. Ma bouteille avait très peu de bulles (pas assez). La Vuur & Vlam était un peu mieux.
Bière orangée, peu effeverscente. Aromes dherbe, de citroon et de malt grillé. Peu de corps, belle amertume, arome de citron, fleurs.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Pours a pale amber/orange color with a medium and persistent white head. Citrus and herbal nose. Aromas are citrus, grass and white flowers. Hoppy and very dry finish. Fizzy carbonation that gives the beer a strange thick texture. An uncommon beer, but rather a good surprise!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at De Molen. Hazy dark orange with a medium off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Bitter with some sweet notes. Citrus, malts and rip fruits. A decent bitter.

Bottle (from De Molen Shop) on the 17.56 Brussels - St Pancras, post Borefts 13, 29/09/13. 
Hazed orange amber with an initial moderately sized off white head that soon dissipates to a covering and edgeing.
Nose is tangy citrus, bitter orange, grass, light spice, dank hop notes.
Taste comprises bitter citrus, orange pith, hint of melon, toasty malts, earthy hop presence.
Medium boided, light prickly carbonation which lets this down a little, dry grassy finish with a modicum of bitterness.
Yay - no soapy flavours as per the previous 2 De Molen bottles on this train journey. Decent little number, but not a bitter by style, more akin to a Golden Blond/APA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Orange, off-white head. Nose is fruity (mainly grapefruity), hoppy, some slightly sweet biscuity malt. Taste is close to the nose, hoppy dry finish with medium bitterness, malt with caramel notes, slight perfume. Medium body, thin to oily texture, soft carbonation. Very easy to drink

330 ml bottle @ Sörmanufaktúra. Cloudy, dark orange colour, short-life medium off-white head, peachy and piney aroma, light body, smooth fizziness, slight sweet caramel and simple hoppy bitter taste, piney and grapefruit hoppy palate. Nice one.

11.2 ounce bottle dated 19/01/2012. Kind of old. Poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a translucent copper with a big white head of foam. Lots of splotchy lacing. The aroma has notes of papery tropical fruits and mild grass notes. Taste has some lemon zest character and a nice, easy going bitterness throughout. Finishes kind of long. For as old as this bottle is, it is actually very nice. One of the best bitters Ive had.

perfect appearance of hazy, dark orange colour, huge, extremely long lasting dense off-white head; aroma and taste of hoppyness (with grassy and citrussy notes), malty sweetness and yeasts; good bitter

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of hops with subtle notes of malt and yeast. Bitter flavour of hops with subtle notes of grass and malt. Mild finish. Slightly watery but OK.

33cl bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with medium white frothy head, looks ok. The aroma is orange, grassy hops and hints of caramel. The flavour is citrus, malts, and ripe fruits. Long bitter-sour finish, very interesting. Medium body, perfect carbonation. Actually simple, but very well balanced. Like!

Bottled, 0.33 l.
Shows a hazy orange amber with a creamy off-white head on its top.
Intensive floral nose and aroma escorted by caramel and citrus fruits.
Mouthfeel is slick, but somewhat thin.
Medium to long and dry finish with distinct herbs and pine.
Balanced, good one.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2015 Pours a hazy gold with a huge white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast and floral hops. Bitter, with some notes of sourness. Easy to drink.

Bottle. Poured orange, with a creamy, white foam. Malty nose with citrus peel, orange. First sip brings lots of fruits with a pleasant lime taste. Medium dense, somewhat harsh on the palate. Dry, bitter, fruity aftertaste. Nothing fancy, but generally a tasty drinking brew.
on tap @ALEhouse, Riga  Heavy hop loaded, seems like intense fresh hopped, grassy american pale ale, definitely not bitter. Easy drinkable although palate is quite medium+. Thick, long lasting top.
UPDATED: APR 10, 2014 Bottle @ home. Pours cloudy and orange. Smells malty/caramel and grapefruit with general citrus fruits. Taste is poor, watery, not the best De Molen out there.

Bottle at De Paas, Den Haag. Poured a hazy medium amber with a big frothy white head. The aroma is rich fruity and hoppy. The flavour is dry, crisp grapefruit citrus with lots of dry acidic yeast on the palate. A very refreshing session beer.

Bottle. Clearish rusty yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of orange peel, musty, honey and herbs. Flavor of cracker malt, medium bitter hops and a light tartness. Lighter body with active carbonation. Y

Hazy, orange color with medium head (lasting cover to the end). Intensive aroma of citrus with some yeasty notes. Taste is nice balanced, lots of citrus hops, malts, spices and yeasts ( probably belgian yeast). However, its 9 plato its surprisingly medium body. Low carbonation. Very good one, but definitely its not bitter. IMO somethig between dubbel and APA.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2015 Mooie oranjegele kleur met een volle schuimkraag. Frisse prettige hop en fruitgeur, citrus en iets bitter. Smaakt fruitig en zuur en weinig bitter. Smaakt tegenvallend. Veel koolzuur.

Pours a dull hazy gold with no head to speak of and a lightly funky aroma - sweet, almost tripel-esque. Taste is lightly sour malt, light hop flavour but not much to speak of. Decent to light carbonation, crisp body. Pleasant.
Tap @ De Molen. Color orange with huge head. Aroma malt, caramel, fruits, hop, dust, yeast. Taste yeast, hop, fruits, peach.

Bottled 33cl. Courtesy of jaghana. Filled to the brim, luckily not a gusher (!) - making it tricky to pour. Catty, yeast accented. I am not sure this beer qualifies as a bitter- perhaps this wasnt the intention initially anyway. Definitely not op & top, irrespective of the style. Thanks jaghana!
Bottle. Pours golden with a large white head. Aroma is grass, hay, cardboard and citrus. Taste is medium bitter. Light body with medium carbonation. Nice bitter, easily sessionable.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 27.07.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy slightly bubbly longlasting head. Aroma is fruity, light malts, citrus, hay, citrus peel, yeast, grass, herbs, hints of cardboard. Taste is slightly sour-ish, citrus peel, grass, hay, wet leafs, cardboard, herbs. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Boring!

Draft at ACBF 2011. Pours auburn with a thick, off-white head. Citrus hop nose, light caramel, honey and melon. Balanced flavor, some sugary malts, plenty of citrus, some pine and earth. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Light warmth in the finish, some resin and rindy citrus fruits. Very nice beer.
14 mars 2013. 4.5%. Blonde. Acide. Sûre. Florale. Semble contaminé. Fruité. Pas sur d'avoir une bonne bouteille.

Mistig oranje met forse witte kop. Geur van sinaasappel, citrus. Smaak wederom citrus, brood, citroen kwarktaart, beetje zoetig caramel. Aardig wat koolzuur. Verfrissend, lekker bij warm weer.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clearish rusty yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of orange peel, musty, honey and herbs. Flavor of cracker malt, medium bitter hops and a light tartness. Lighter body with active carbonation. Not bad but tastes a bit old.
Bottle, june 22nd 2013. Cloudy dark orange body, big white head. Aroma of lemon, bread and yeast. Light taste of lemon, raisins, wheat and caramel. Good bitterness, light sweet and grassy aftertaste.
Very refreshing beer, acid citrus taste, with some bitter aftertaste. fine foam. Id rather drink this at 5°C instead of 7°C as recommended.

Pouring at The Festival in Portland with Kramer, Andrew, and J-Dadmond. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Soft musk, light wheat. Crisp musk, wheat and light funkiness. Musky, fuzzy phenols. Tangy wheat into the finish.
Tap. Hazy orange color. Medium size head, stays. Grainy, hops, malty, sweet notes in aroma. Sour, bitter, yeasty, malty, hops in flavor. Watery mouthfeel. Dry crisp aftertaste.
12oz Bottle pours a hazy dirty brown color with large frothy head. Great bitterness along with flavors typical of a great home brew. Reminiscent of Schneider Hopfen Weiss.

Bottle at Ølbutikken. Hazy yellow with a white head, ok lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel), light hoppy. Flavor light sweet and hoppy. Light body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mijn eerste biertje van de molen en dat smaakt naar meer. Prima fris biertje, alleen helaas te duur. Daar is hij niet speciaal genoeg voor.

Didnt realize u was paying premium import prices for a bitter. These guys do it well but nothing overly special here. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Aroma Italy, some resin. Bitter finish. Bottle from Steamworks store.

A thick yellowish color, with an extra dose of co2 wich will generate lots of foam. The aroma is a reminder of a mild IPA, as well as the palate. Notes of corn, malts and belgian hops On both the palate and retro taste, but a non satisfactory finish, rather weak and alcoholic. Great aroma and good bitterness makes this beer an enjoyable one nonetheless.
Smak och doft av humle, tropisk frukt, passionsfrukt. Liten beska, frisk karaktär.

Very nice to drink bitter and super easy to drink. Medium hazy orange with a frothy, hugs the glass lacy, white, head. Smell is not of a traditional English Bitter but defiantly American influenced. Toasted malt, caramel, citrus-grapefruit, peach, yeast and some light grassy hops. Light thin body with soft carbonation. Tastes of fruit (melon, grape, peach) with  caramel and toasted malt. Some orange citrus. Bitter lasting dry pine finish. Light maltiness and a bit watery but it went down very easy.

Bottle - thanks Mr. Hangover! Pours hazy amber with a gigantic creamy white head. Takes forever to pour a full glass. I am sure it laces well, but come on!. Aroma is a light mix of pine, caramel, grain. Flavor is about the same. Minimal sweetness, light bitterness. Light bodied and refreshing. Not flat despite the amount of CO2 that went into foam generation. Pretty average beer
Röd-brun-orange, litet vitt skum. Doft: Humle, limpa, svarta vinbärsblad, brännässlor. Smak: Apelsin-grape, jord, mineraler, "fanta", limpa.
On tap. Golden with massive white head. Aroma of malt, spice, yeast, and some esters. Taste is fairly high in bitterness with a dry profile, some fruit and yeast. Not my tea cup
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines;  hazy golden yellow pour with foam off white head, grassy citrus aroma, pleasant citrus taste, Belgian yeast spicy, bitter really enjoyable.

Hazy pale golden with huge white lasting head. Bit lacing
Aroma.. quite citrus hoppy, kinda grapefruit, moderate malts, yeasty. Grassy, pine
Quite dry and moderate bitter finish with some notes of sour.
Hmm.. overall I would say nothing special, but theres something that makes this brew pleasant. I guess its good balance and nice refreshing qualities

29/III/13 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - bottled: 24/II/12 (2013-276) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle! 
Little cloudy orange to amber beer, irregular off-white head, bit stable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet ripe fruits, bit chemical, paint, sweet sugary malts. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: fruity, some citrus, grassy, hops, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: pretty watery, bit chemical bitterness, little sourish. Meh.

On tap @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Some herbal, grassy aromas. Pours bright gold, clear, with frothy white head, persistent, good lacing. Light to medium body, average carbonation, slightly crispy texture. Taste is mild bitter, herbal, qith some sweet notes, along with fruity ones. Balanced and enjoyable.

Pours hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is lemon and yeasty with herbal, maybe rosemary notes. Tastes of Belgian bready/yeastiness with lemon, pepper, grapefruit and a mild hop bite. American hops are apparent. Body is full but lively with sparkling carbonation. This is a refreshing ale, seeming more pale or golden than bitter with a Belgian-like character.
33cl bottle from de hopduvel in Gent. Hazzy amber body with large white head. Fruity aroma. Strong carbonation. Taste apple. **

Bottle, 1 year old. Pours hazy copper with a small white head. Aroma is like a typical bitter with the malts, but it also has a nice fruity hoppiness. Taste is also caramel malts, fruity hops and a medium bitterness. Quite some taste for the low abv and a decent body.

Room temp bottle, a year old.  Pours very pale yellow.  No head.  Smells lemony and herbal.  Quite high carbonation and quite foamy in mouth.  Flavour is initially typical De Molen caramel but this soon disappears.  Some citrus with a lager finish.  Gets a bit watery later on so that it almost tastes like tonic water.  Its qualities are very good and interesting, but they dont come together very well.  Still, it deserves a decent score.

Pours a hazy light amber/orange color with an off-white head. Fruity, hoppy citrus aroma with some caramel. Fruity, fresh and hoppy  flavor with caramel notes. Bottle. Shared with the Bean. Pours opaque honey golden with a fat fluffy white head. Aroma of corn, Belgian spice and yeast, and strange bubblegum/banana fruit esters. I smell grass and citrus. Bad pour so alot of residue, though golden with nice light foam. A bit sweet and medium bitter, light.

Pours a orange/golden color, clear liquid and a frothy white head.
The smell was hard to detect. I think orange and lemon?
The taste is light bitterness and very light sweetness.
I didnt really liked the palate. The carbonation was to fizzy. The body is light and watery with a abrupt finish.

Nice average beer.

On keg at the Chelmsford Winter Beer Festival, 22/02/13. Clear yellow-orange. Good, persistent head. Sweet, tropical hop aroma. Lovely, fresh tropical hop flavours, lightly sweet fruit, with a light, cereally malt. Lychee, grapefruit, satsuma. Lovely fruit, but light, refreshing and not overwhelming.

Fruchtiges Bouquet nach Citrus und Pampelmuse. Im Geschmack empfinde ich das Fruchtige allerdings als unangenehm überreif. Zum Glück greift zügig der aromatische Hopfen ein und überdeckt diese Note. Für mich eines der schwächeren de Molen Biere.

Slightly burgundy and oaky orange
Minimal head
Amarillo is heavy. 
Very candy like and bitter.

appearance: Yellow, nearly orange and slightly hazy. Has a nice white foam top. 

smell: Fllowery, citrus, wheaty, grassy, fruity. 

taste: A lovely light flavored beer for a hot afternoon. Floral, hops, wheaty, a nice nectar like sweetness and a light citrus / grapefruit like bitter finish.

mouthfeel: Very soft, nectar like, almost satin. Medium carbonation for a bit of a fresh pop and quite thin and light.

overall: If youre out on a hot day, this is the one you want to drink. Its light, easygoing and well balanced in flavor.

Tap. Hazy rusty color with a small white nicely lacing head. Aroma is wood, bark, earthy hops, leather, very light grapefruit. Taste is light+ sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, oily titties, light+ carbonation. Light dry and medium grapefruity bitter finish with woody notes.

Draught at 3 Små Rum, Göteborg, on February 27, 2013Cloudy orange color, tan head. Sweet, estery, perfume, hints of phenoles, some citrus scent. Herbal, hoppy, dry, mineral taste. Mineral, hoppy, herbal aftertaste. Spritzy mouthfeel. Mineral tingly tongue feeling. Medium bitterness, though somewhat outmastered by the spritziness.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 330ml bottle (BB Brevinga, Riga) (7:3:7:4:14=3.5)
Nice perfumey aroma, a little floral, pleasant sweet fleshy fruits too. Lovely crisp palate. Hazy marmalade colour, large tight head, alas some flecks floating around. Gently grainy body. Husky bitterness, nutty finish. Such an eas drinker. The carbonation is quite high, though.
Rerate: Tap (P6rgu, Tallinn) (6:3:6:3:12=3.0)
Not what i used to be. Sharp lemon juice aroma, sour? Orange, huge keggy head. Slightly watery palate, more hints its starting to sour. Not a patch on the former bottle, dont believe this is what Menno wanted us to drink, so not adjusting rating.

Orange colour with a sparkling white head.
Aroma is fresh hoppy and citrus. In mouth is medium bitter and spicy.
Carbonation is little bit too high.

Bottle from Capones.  Pours turbid dark straw color with 2-finger fluffy off-white head.  Nose is very floral hops, much like Flower Power, with some white peppery spice notes also.  Tastes crisp, with a big floral white peppery hop pop up front, perfumy esters at mid-palate, and a heavily floral and hoppy finish.  This one is delicious, and very under-rated by the peanut gallery here.

Appearance: Hazy amber color with an off white head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Rich hoppy.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Nice fresh rich hoppy! Overall impression: Lovely bitter!Personal stats: Bottle from Meny Oslo City in Oslo, Norway.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange-copper color with a very small head. Nose is rather hoppy with a hint of floral hops. Taste actually isnt very bitter, but very smooth with just a hint of sour in there. Interesting brew.

Bottle. Poured clear dark amber hue with an average frothy off-white head that Mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy aroma of earthy floral hop. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. This is a solid brew.

Kaatuu lasiin oranssinruskeana ja sameana, käytännössä vaahdottomana. Haju on trooppisen hedelmäinen (sitrusta, päärynää), maltaisena, yrttinen, ruohoinen ja hieman puinen. Maku on hedelmäinen (tuoretta ja kuivattua), maltainen, puinen ja ruohoinen. Suutuntuma on kevyehkö, mutta mukava humalan puraisu tuntuu. Oikeastaan tuntuma on oikein miellyttävä. Kokonaisuutena todella mukava ruokakauppaolut, jota ei bitteriksi uskoisi (paitsi suuhun jäävästä katkeruudesta) vaan on melkein jo pale alen puolella.

Pours a cloudy golden colour with a bit of an orange tinge with a bit of white head. Aromas of grass, floral notes, bread, caramel, some sweetness. Flavours are caramel, earthy hops, bread, a nicely balanced light bitter dry beer.

Pours a murky orangish copper with with a small white ring and spotty lacing. Aroma of caramel, grass, sweet fruits & floral notes. Taste is has some caramel & bread to it but is fairly dry and bitter throughout.
Really fine bitter. Dusty taste and nice dry finish. The aroma reminded me of wet grass. Mhm..not bad!

Pineapple and lillies on the nose, very light oaty malt in the background. Clear amber, thick sticky billowy head.  Intensely floral flavor initally, bitter marigold, with lemon flesh accents and a lemon zest finish. Lacks British malt or hop character. Delicious beer, not representative of a bitter. More like an APA.

A very fruity smell, strong aroma of hops and grapefruit. Very nice and refreshing. The small white creamy head has a long duration. The body is dark orange. The taste is very bitter, quite medical. The finish is long and bitter. The body is light to medium strong, creamy and dry in the finish with a normal carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy dark yellow color. Medium thick foamy white head with lacing. Aroma of fruity hops with peach and apricot. Quite dry taste of hops with some sweetness. Medium bitter finish.
Bottle 0.33l from local market. Colour is golden with massive white head. Aromas and flavours are grass, fruits and hops.

Bottle 33 cl, bottled on 10.04.2012. Hazy pale golden in color with a frothy white head. Parfume, some earthy notes, very light barnyard also. Tasty, some bitterness, wild, more sweeter berries and even some light spicy in taste. Almost like a witbier, very fruity though in this case and perhaps with some more subtle spicier hints in the finish.

Bottle. Hazy orange color with a large white head. Hoppy aroma with notes of fruits, grass and some caramel malt. Flavor is orange, grass, malt and some bitterness. Light body, slightly bitter aftertaste.
330ml Tomlinsons Inverness. Citrus nose, light golden body, bitter palate, smooth, a bit grassy. Yep, not bad at all.

a dutch made Bitter? Huh. Pours hazy golden hue capped by a gernerous cratter rock off white head thas was staying power. Lacing sticks to the side of my shaker. Nose of gentle biscuit and flower. Taste has solid bitterness upfront that molds into tangerine, lemon, and an lovely bouquet of flowers. Body is light but solid. Nice.

Light brown beer with a foam bath head. Aromas of lemon and yeast. There is some acidic sourness to the taste with bitter grape fruity and soapy hops. Body is medium. I actually would not expect to find this quality beer from a Finnish supermarket. Really, really good.

No head (maybe just a couple of bubbles hanging on to the side) and hazy orange body. Aroma of citrus, flowers, and some caramel. Taste of citrus and bitter, very low carbonation which makes me think theres something wrong with my bottle (its over a year old, though the label does say up to two) Palate fairly bitter. I think that fresh this would be better, but as is its mediocre at best

genre bitter?? seriously? This is no bitter, more like a dry and hoppy belgian. Barnhouse aroma, very floral and earthy. Blond with a huge head that exploded when poured. Long dry finish, very yeasty again from De Molen. Some funk. Very good stuff, and very good for a low alc beer. thanks martinus
Bottle from supermarket. Thick orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, floral hops, grass and fruits. Bitter, fruity finish. Quite like a pale ale actually. Very bice brew.

bottle @ homùe, bottled 24 / 2 / 2012 , today is october 31, 2012. so almost a year. 
pours very normal ( orange , fast fading foam) and also smell is very basic ( typical de molen hoppy smell - starting to see what everyone means by that - but hey, its my second or even first favourite brewerie on this date, so thats not bad at all to me . 
very viving foam, very hoppy, yet heavier than an IPA. an IPA is more refreshing to me, while i would call this a heavy hopped beer ( if that makes any scence) it hasnt got this lightness and extreme drinkability ( well its pretty damn drinkable still ) as a IPA does. i like this but its kinda what i expected of it. nothing special, just a random, good made beer by the molen. yet im always glad when im not dissapointed so cheers do this
Flaska på Bishop Arms.  Tappdatum september 2011, enligt etikett. Riktigt avslaget skum. Doft av svunna tider när denna flaskas innehåll var nytt. Smakar riktigt, riktigt avslaget.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20101209.
Pours copper color with a medium head. Aroma of fruits, caramel, grassy hops and mild malts. Flavor of caramel malts, hay, fruits and some hops. Bitter palate.

Bottled.  Poured medium golden with a short, dense white head.  The aroma picked up lemon rind, orange, and funky earth hoppage over pale malts.. peppery and a touch oxidized.. OK.  The flavor found pale malts with a touch of bread at the core.. sharply bitter citrus and grassy notes around.. finished with a wash of residual bitterness and some minerally water.  Lighter-bodied with tight-bubbled carbonation on the palate.. bitterness was rough and too dominant.. just OK overall.
Clear golden orange with a fizzy white head. Nice citrusy aroma, pretty faint. Little spicy with some lemon and yeast. Nice casual bitter with an acidic carbonation.
This is a exploding geisher, be careful. We try with three different with different date, one explodes in our hands...
On tap in Doerak, Poured golden with a small white head, Aroma of citrus (orange), Medium bodyfeel, flavour of bitter orange with a slightly bitter aftertaste.
2012.10.11 - bottle 33cl -  clear orange beer with white head - nose: -fruity/hoppy nose - mouth : citrus and hops, light bitterness

Cloudy amber pour with a white head. Really bland aroma on this. A bit of bready malt, some toast, and a hint of floral and citrus peel hops. There are some grass notes and floral hops on the palate with a hint of citrus peel bitterness. Very light malt sweetness of toasted bread.

Draught at La Fine Mousse, ParisHazy amber color; huge creamy head. Nice hop aroma, some hop fruitiness. Lack of carbonation after all that foam; good malt flavor, some caramel, good bitterness with delicate hop qualities. Good.

(33cl bottle) Purchased at Hillside Liquor in Victoria, BC, for $4.49. Pours a very large white frothy head atop a cloudy orange body. Nose is lemony, yeasty and tonic. Good citrus hop flavour. Highly flavorful for a 4.5% ABV.

--- reviewed on RateBeer.com

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 330ml bottle. Pours a slightly murky yellow brown with medium head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of malts, raisins, and biscuit. Flavors of cereal and wheat. Acidic bitter finish.

Pours slightly cloudy orange colour with a tall creamy white head. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel with some yeasty and fruity notes. Taste is also malty with caramel, toasty, woody and fruity notes and yeast leading to a moderate bitter finish. Pretty good.

330mL bottle, pours a clear golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of very light English hops and biscuity malts to back - very subtle nose. Flavour is very restrained and subtle, with some citrusy hops and cereal malts. Pretty banal, as expected, but also decently balanced and unobtrusive. Decent.
Pours a murky orange gold with thick bubbled half inch of cream head. Aroma is lemony bitter and cereal malt. Taste is citrus hops with a prominent yeast note. Finish is crisp and solid. Nice.

330mL bottle to taster
Aroma is sweet and fruity with some bitterness. Appearance is a pale amber with no head. Taste is malty and sweet with nice mild bitterness. Mouthfeel is light and thin.

Beer with lots of floaty stuff. Small white cap. Light biscuity malts with mild cardboard, succulent peachy softness, milder grapeftuit and a touch of something tropical. Tastes pretty good too bad is is such a tiny bottle. 330ml session? Boo. The taste is mellow with a mellow bitterness with citrus just sharp enough to contradict what I just said in less than one sentence. k. Got busy and forgot about this beer - another sign that is pointing me towards not spending so much money on the endless supply of good beer around here. 7-up taste with soft citrus, mild malts, some zing. Got soooo bored.
Quite a special bitter. Very fruity, lots of perfume. I would enjoy seeing more bitters utilizing flavourful American hops.

330ml brown bottle. Deep gold coloured brew, slightly hazy. Creamy white cap. Aroma has earth and citrus. Taste has citrus peels, light fruity malt. Light bitterness at the end, some earth, citrus (orange and slight grapefruit) aftertaste. Light body and decent carbonation. Well hopped for a bitter, enjoyable.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours pale golden with no head. Aroma is of citrus, malt, sweet, caramel. Taste is of citrus, malt, sweetness. Overall: light body. Sligtly bitter finish. Bottle 1 yo. its too old? This beer lacks something.
Hazy golden yellow with quickly dissapearing white foam head. Hoppy aroma and taste, not too bitter. Short dry bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201208)

Bottle (330 ml). Thanks to SlovakSniper for this one! Golden orange with no head and no lacing. Aroma of citrus, malt and caramel. Taste is much softer than aroma with notes of malt, caramel and citrus. Slight bitter finish. Thin body, almost watery. Very drinkable but not complex at all.
Shared on keg with wife. Nice sustainable head. American hops in the nose and taste, with a crisp finish. Drinks like an American pale ale that went easy on the hops.

On keg.
Fizzy gold with a big white head.
The smell is lemon and some orange. 
Taste: Lemon, orange, pale malts, and spices.

Medium shiny very white head. Slightly hazy body with light carbonation. Earthy very ripe tropical fruit aroma with dusty buttery floral notes. Dry-sweetish earthy ripe tropical fruit and strawberry taste with buttery earthy notes. MId-to-full body. Mild, soft, dusty mouthfeel. Dryish mealy earthy tropical fruit aftertaste with dusty grassy notes. Nice, drinkable, and very unusual. (0.4l draft at Amundsen, Oslo.)
