geel-oranje kleur, goede kraag. Aroma van grapefuit en gist. Smaakt een beetje grapefruit en is behoorlijk droogbitter. Behoolijk wat body. Hele droge afdronk.
The picture of this on my phone is of the bottle next to an empty glass. A sure sign this was enjoyed so much I forgot to take a pic. So, must be good.
bottle. Pours orange white head nose oxidized cheese citrus flavors of cheeses citrus bread good stuff

Ottima bitter che riesce a rendere equilibrate le note maltatate e quelle luppolate. Corpo medio, schiuma discreta ma di bassa consistenza al naso è floreale e agrumata. in bocca escono fuori anche note maltate e caramellate con un bel finale luppolato. bevuta alla spina al Festival di Castellalto 2012.

Bottle. Pours a hazy deep golden color with a nice, white head. Very malty head with a hint of spices. Not that bitter of a taste. Smooth with a dry finish. Different spices. Sage, parsley, etc. Interesting brew.

A beautiful medium amber body with a craftbeer-ish haze dwells underneath a large, off-white head that never reduces beyond a healthy layer of creamy foam. Excellent lacing. The aroma is quite strong and very pleasant with equal amounts of malty and hoppy notes. I get caramel, pine needles, flowers, citrus, fruits, spices, dust and some surprising Belgian-like yeasty notes. The taste is light sweet with a long-lasting moderate bitter finish. Lots of dry and spicy citric crispiness blended with the belgian-like yeast. Ok mouthfeel, although its a bit watery and light bodied. The carbonation is moderate to soft. A wonderful bitter meets pilsener meets APA meets belgian ale! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Meny Oslo City, Oslo]

Bottle. Hazy amber with thin foam. Smells like a glass. What happened to the aroma hops?  Weird flavour. Tastes like something that tastes somewhat like beer. Pineapple, floral, medicinal and a bit weird.

Bottle. Holy smokes is this thing ever lively! Required a three-stage pour. Murky, dull orange amber with a very lively head that settles rather quickly into a half-centimeter pad that stays. Aroma is cool-- cream and orange (like a creamsicle) intermingle with conifer and light soap. The palate is actually fairly low on carbonation, but that may be because it was all lost during the pour. Earthy and slightly vegetal flavour profile, more dry than sweet, with touches of grapefruit and light perfumey conifer. Very dry, moderately bitter. A rustic and boldly-hopped take on the style.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, pours a hazy glowing orange. Huge fluffy off white boquet of a head accompanied by great lace. Aromas of Belgian yeasts, citrus hops and zest. Taste is a nice fresh and clean tasting bitter. Notes of malts, peach, pine, and grapefruit. Medium to full bodied for the 4.5%. I dont usually gravitate toward bitters but this thing was nice and hoppy.
180112@DØE Århus Syd De Molen tasting: Golden / orange fine hoppy beer with good foam that gave lace on the glass. However, there were small volcano opening. Good hoppy aroma and taste. Biter end.

330ml bottle pours a slightly cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that settles to leaves a few spots of lacing.  Aroma is light citrus and earthy hop notes with some caramel.  Taste is a herbal citrus bitterness and an underlying fruit and malty sweetness.  Light bodied with some adequate carbonation leaving a pleasant sensation on the palate.  Definitely has some English bitter style properties and is quite a refreshing brew.

A welcome addition to the Norwegian supermarket range.
Hazy gold/yellow.
Apricots, grapefruit, Belgian yeast. Rich and complex, dry finish.

Pours dirty straw, small head lingers a bit after dissipating. Aroma of crisp floral hops. Was expecting kind of a pale ale, but on repeat sips it becomes a bit watery. Hops arent as pronounced as I would like.
From bottle at the post office vaults. Nice, light, fresh and refreshing. Slightly bitter almost lagers taste at the end.

Sinaasappel, mandarijn en bloemen in aroma. Smaak is wat dun, en zet niet door wat aroma in potentie heeft. Desondanks een palet met bloemen en wat citrus tonen, die de nasmaak overheersen, maar is wat uit balans.

On. Bottle from Meny Oslo S.
Golden color, good foam, Zoe sediments.
Fruity, grapefruit and some tropical fruit.
Medium body & complexity.
Good bitterness
Enjoyable

Pours golden blonde, write head. It isnt much on the nose - just a little sweet and fruity. Flavour is light and delicate - not much going on, just a little sweet with some gentle bitterness. Its just there... Nice but not fabulous.

4th October 2010The 2nd De Molen gusher on the bounce! Cloudy amber beer, big suddy white head. Light dry palate. Creamy malt, a little hop and some mild soap. Finishes dry with some hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Okay but as with the Borefts Blond - mildly infected.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours cloudy orange copper with a modest off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty caramel malt flavor with a nice hop profile. Very well-balanced with lots of flavor for a relatively low alcohol brew.
Bottle from ABC Beers.  Pours clear golden with a white head.  Aroma of citrus, fruit and slight earthiness.  Flavour is light sweet, medium bitter.  Medium bodied with  soft carbonation.

Botella de 330ml. Vaso de ½ Pinta. Saboreada en jun´12. Color dorado profundo y apariencia velada. Espuma algodonosa, blanca y de burbuja pequeña. Capa no muy amplia, con buena retención. Aromas picantes, terrosos y notas cítricas. Gentil y limpio amargor con toque cítrico. Paladar suave y textura oleosa. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Trazos de miel en el intermedio con matices de piel de limón. Agradable cerveza para ir de cañas. Buena representante del Estilo English Bitter.
330ml bottle. ½ Pint glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Deep golden color, hazy appearance. White, rocky, small bubbled, froth. Not so wide crown. Good retention. Earthy & spicy aromas, citric notes. Gentle clean bitterness, citric fruit touch. Smooth palate, oily texture. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Hints of honey in the middle with citric zest hues. Pleasant session beer. Close to English bitter Style.
Väldigt doftsvag..men desto smakrikare. Ganska fyllig och trevlig maltig-metallisk smak men..jag är inte så värst imponerad.

Bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Clear amber with a slight, white head. Citrus and stone fruit aromas with slightly earthy malts. Full mouth feel, slight spiciness and more fruit flavours with a yeasty edge, leading to a dryish finish. Enjoyable.
Pours a orange troebel colored beer with a 2 finger head. Aroma of yeast and citrus, very refreshing taste with a bitter aftertaste, typical molen beer
Ottima birra, molto ben amaricata, con un corpo non troppo internso, anzi quasi con un finale leggermente watery

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color : orange golden copper. Its a really nice color, you want to taste it but this beer is without head... Smell : hops. Taste : spring taste, orange, flowers and hops: after taste : hops and orange.

Aroma: Sugar cane sweetness, white pepper and a musty, yeasty aroma.

Appearance: Hazy golden body with yeast flecks floating. Huge white head that lasts. Lots of carbonation. Slight lacing. 

Taste: Very yeasty. Initial sweetness is replaced by a dampened citrus bitterness. Slightly bland. 

Palate: Thin, watery mouthfeel. Lively carbonation on the tongue. 

Overall: This is my first beer by Brouwerij de Molen and, given their reputation, its a bit of a disappointment.

Bottle (33cl). Hazy, light amber colour. Half-inch offwhite head, good retention. Saison-like aroma of fruit (plums), hops, yeast and spices (coriander seed). Body is light to medium, soft carbonation. Taste is fruity at first with some sweetness, then gradually drier with a solid bitterness in the finish.

[Thanks to bierkoning]. 33cl bottle. Light orangish colour with an off-white head, a lot of carbonic and medium lacing. Aroma is hoppy, moderate malty and slightly fruity. Flavour is bittery at the beginning, with orange peel notes and malty. The final is moderate to heavy bittery and dry. Carbonation is medium.

0.33l bottle @ Patricks, Kristiansand. This one pours a light blurry golden/orange-ish body with a nice big just off-white head. On the aroma this is actually quite fruity and really spicy. Like in Christmas spices! Nutmeg and cardamom dominating next side with clementine zest, coriander, peaches, wheat and yeast. Quite different from what I was expecting, but I really like it! The body is medium to thin and its average carbonated. Nice almost "american wit-like" flavors in this one. Its quite fruity and well balanced. Peachy fruits with lots of spicy tones as well. A really good surprise from Them Molens and it really made an impression with its low alcohol level. 30.03.2012

A bloody excellent beer. Beautiful in the glass, with a fluffy foamy head. The inital taste is round and fruity but not sweet. The aftertaste is long, dry and a tad bitter. I was lucky to buy this beer and im looking forward to my next!

330 ml bottle @ Patricks. Dark golden body with a big, creamy white head. Aroma of malt, grapefruit and some blackcurrant with hint of yeast. Flavor is malty and fruity with a pleasant bitterness. Medium body and decent aftertaste. Nothing extraordinary, but rather true to the style and definitively a nice one at only 4,5% alcohol.
Bottle. deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is dry, fruit, malt, hop. flavour is dry, fruit, malt, hop, yeast, orange. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

On tap at De Molen pouring clear gold with narrow copper core and tall nearly tight off white head. The aroma is sort of floral and spicy and earthy with hops as well as faint malt sweetness in the background. The taste is similar with nice crisp spicy to bitter floral hops and then some earthy hops with a mild biscuit like maltiness around the edges. Drinkin good.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 On cask. Not too hazy gold wtih a thick white top. Hardly any smell getting through the thick head, but a few malty breezes. Heavy wheaty mouth, some straw, fresh bitter grapefruity bite. Cracking. 

---

Had again. This time a little less head allowing the nose to shine - mango and pineapple. The fruits show up more in the mouth too. More mango, more pineapple, still cracking.

Keg at North Bar Leeds (Lowlands Festival). Pours a pair copper, small head that fades. Aroma is really nice - citrus-hoppy but with a wheat beer-esque twang running through it. Taste is similar, but more hoppy, a little mineral water taste too. Slightly watery mouthfeel, nice CO2 price, good crisp, bitter finish. Refreshing, clean and interesting, this one.
surprisngly boring as I expected a lot more. the hops are delicious ofcourse.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur ambrée-dorée et très légèrement voilée. Nez de houblon floral et citrique (pamplemousse) avec des notes herbeuses (herbes fraîches), fruité (agrumes, traces de fruits tropicaux) et léger de malt sucré aux faibles notes caramélisées. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement bas-moyen et une texture légèrement aqueuse et aux petites notes huileuses. Goût moyennement amer de houblon citrique et légèrement floral (une amertume présente en arrière-goût toute la gorgée) accompagné dun moyen goût fruité (agrumes, faibles traces dabricots) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un léger goût de biscuits avec des notes de caramel puis en finale le houblon herbeux prend le dessus pour rehausser doucement lamertume (herbes très fraîches). Post-goût moyen et aux faibles notes asséchantes, moyennement amer de houblon citrique et légèrement herbeux avec un léger goût fruité (zeste dagrumes).

Bottle from Oslo City enjoyed at home
Copper hazy with a white head, super nice laces. Smells of citrus, earthy notes and malts. Taste is medium malty, light sweetness and some zesty taste. Light to medium body, soft carbonation. Nice hoppy finish with typical amarillo citrus but also an intense resin bitterness. Finish lasts forever, nice. I had this against Amerikaans that is the same style, and i have to say that when i liked Amerikaans a bit better, Op & Top is more true to the style

Bottle from Meny, Oslo City. Pours slightly hazy light amber with a small white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, malt and caramel. Sweet, fruity and lightly bitter with a pleasant hoppy aftertaste. A bit watery, but nice and refreshing. Easy to drink.
Slightly cloudy amber with a decent white head.  Citrus and hop aromas and nice fruity hop flavour.
Bottle. Cloudy light amber beer with a good head. Fruity hop flavour with a solid maltiness. Very drinkable.

On tap at the Farmers Cabinet before the De Molen dinner.  Clear orange with an off-white head.  Nose is orange, caramel and light grass.  Medium light with flabby carb.  Taste is mild lemon pith, slight bitter grass and a touch of red fruit; barely sweet.  A bit washed out but nicely sessionable.
Bottle from the National Winter Ales Festival, 2012. Orange/amber pour no head. Not much carbonation. Fruit and caramel aroma. Caramel and bitter-malt flavour. Bitter-sweet finish. Hmm...
Floral, grass, fruity, citrus bitter fresh beer dry finish  ligt sparking color white head
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Copper orange pour, citrusy hops with some floral notes in the aroma. Hop dominate flavor, light cardboard, pretty flavorful for 4.5%. Decent

Very good beer. If you havent been to this brewery, youd be surprised. It is somewhat small but definitely amazing to see what they use to make world class beer.  This is a good representation of a good beer from De Molen.
Det här är en hyfsad öl med en bra beska. Smaken är lätt citrusaktig och ölen ligger väldigt fint i strupen.

Bottle from Bierkoning, thank you! Hazy light brown with a huge head. Lovely American hops aroma - lychee, peach, pineapple and mandarine, some less resin. Light body but full of flavour, with a tropical main part and a finish that is grassy and earthy, with a herbal bitterness. That finish adds some nice Europeanness to the otherwise American flavour. Very light and refreshing. The only problem I have with it is the massive, biting carbonation.

Aroma: Fruity. 
Appearance: Hazy orange with strong white head. 
Tatse: very bitter, fruity. 
Palate: light body, thin feel, lively, bitter. 
Overall: I like this beer really good bitter taste.

Bouteille de 330 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel et dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût doranges avec une pointe de caramel et de citronnelle. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture minérale. Forte effervescence en bouche. Présence de zestes doranges amers en arrière goût. (Rating #4128)

Bottle: Poured a dirty beige color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma consists of floral and bitter hops with light citrus notes. Taste is also dominated by quite strong floral and citrus notes with a semi-astringent finish. Dry caramel malt backbone can be felt though is not particularly dominant. Body is about average with good carbonation and no alcohol. Nothing earth shattering but easily drinkable and enjoyable.

AROMA: heather, honey, flowers
APPEARANCE: no head, golden, clear
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
PALATE: light body, thin feel, flat, abrupt finish
OVERALL: IPA but with quite a flowery aroma, too flat, just not that exciting
Bottle. Amber with white head. Tropical hop flavour. Malty character. Not an impressive beer. Drinkable though.

Tasted on draft at Holy Grale during Zwanze Day 2011.  Pours hazy orange with a massive, rocky, off-white head that slowly recedes to uneven lace.  The nose is lightly malty with some orange notes, and a hint of light caramel.  The flavor is very light with the same orange oil note and nice bitterness on the back of the palate.  The body is light with light carbonation and a long bitter orange peel finish.
Bottle from cervezalandia, spain. Amber/orange color. Medium to thick white head. High carbonation. Medium to high bitterness and low sweetness. Hop, fruit and smoke aroma.

33 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 20.05.2011
Lots and lots of foam  I had to get another glass for the liquid part. Aroma has lots of fresh and fruity hops with some toffee. Flavour has hops, exotic fruits, some toffee and caramel. Also hints of earthy notes and vegetables that are stronger in the yeastier glass. Rather nice bitter that differs from the british ones and kind of reminds me of De Molen Engels.
Golden, clear coloration. Off white head. Hop character has a champagne dryness to it. Bitterness is saved to the end, tastes of juniper. Watery and thin bodied.  A bit of grapefruit.

Bottle at the Post Office Vaults, Birmingham. A very Belgian type ale: yes I get the IPAness, but it remains a primarily Beneluxian experience, due to the yeast flavour, which is more prominent than the amarillo hops. Thin, no head. A bit watery, with some plastic. A smidge sharp, but enjoyed overall.
Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - grapefruit and pine. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 180112
(Bottle 18/01-2012) Medium off-white head, unclear orange color, hoppy aroma, slightly bitter, fit body, very balanced. Bottled 10 JUN 2011.

I served that beer in a normal pint.
That is very puzzling: no foam, no bubbles, nothing.
The nose is fantasticly complex and rich: almond, honey, red fruits, white flowers, malty ... very fine and subtle.
On the palate it is really disappointing as there is no carbonedioxide. So the mouth is flat.
I think this particular bottle has not been fermented the second time so no CO2 thus no gas nor foam. Maybe this batch failed. I will taste it again another day to be sure.

Bottle 33 cl from erzbierschof.ch. Orangy blonde with furious crackling and huge cream foam. Fruity aromas, lemongrass, spicy hop, hint of soap. The taste is malted, mellow, with a grassy bitter and notes of cosmetic, lipstick and lychee. Crispy, slight but tasty, the finale is dry, lemon-citrus, average bitter.

330ml bottle, golden color, with a rocky white head, light orange, tangerine peel floral hop nose, with a soft leafy, grassy accent, within a faint honey pale, toasted malt aroma follows through on a medium- bodied palate with a mild yeasty, citrus orange, lemon, tangerine peel, peach flowery hop character with some light piney, leafy, hoppy flavours, with a hint of honeyed pale, toasted malt sweetness, leading towards a soft zesty lemon peel, lingering leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange amber with a large, white, cloudy head. Aroma is exotic fruits, slightly piney, passion fruity. Taste is dry with grapefruit, nettles and caramel. Palate is a bit watery, stingy with hops, refreshing. Rather thin, but thats to be expected at these strengths.
33cl bottle, thanks tkrjukoff. Pours pale yellow with a huge white head. Smells grassy hoppy, abit citrus. Tastes bubbly, grassy hoppy and citrus with a similar finish.

In short: A bright refreshing blonde IPA with a sharp lemony/grassy/fruity/spicy hopping.  Nice
How: Bottle 330ml.  Consumed 9 months after bottling date unfortunately hard to get De Molen beers fresher than this over here
The look: Cloudy dark blonde body topped by a large white head with good retention
In long: The hoppy nose is bright, very floral, lemongrass, yellowed grass and dried lemon zest.  Interesting.  Taste is a bead of neutral bready pale malts, fluffy yeast that does not take too much room and a bright crisp hopping.  Hops are lemony, grassy, floral, spicy and a bit topical/citrus fruits.  Finish is moderately bitter, a bit tart and a bit acidic.  This beer is very refreshing and absolutely sessionable.  This is again a bottle conditioned yeasty European IPA except that in this case it doesnt turn into a muddy yeast soup and the beer remains crisp and fun.  I liked that beer more than I thought I would, a pleasant surprise.  Its amazing how an surprisingly good beer can cheer me up.  I thin I know the solution to cure sadness: it is good beer.  And I also know the solution for world hunger: it is food.  Anybody else has complex social-economic problems to solve?

33cl bottle @ the Brauhaus. Pours a light amber colour with a decent head. The nose is hay and honey and there is more of the same on the taste. The palate has a medium body, a medium sized creamy texture and a clean finish. Overall, solid but not amazing.

Giuro che appena trovo in giro una bottiglia con un minimo di carbonazione gli do il voto che si merita, diamine, è una birra che chiaramente ha delle qualità, appare bevibile anche piatta, ho cominciato a credere che de molen la facesse proprio così, ma in internet trovo commenti di chi la trova vivacemente frizzante... e allora sarò io molto sfortunato.
Unclear orange of color with an off white head. An aroma of hops, citrus, grapefruit, fresh and bitter. A flavor of citrus, hops, dusty, bitter and a nice dry finish.
Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is refreshing fruits and hops. Light, almost watery flavor is malts with a hoppy finish. A bit light but good.

Tap at Frisco Taphouse in Columbia, MD. The pour is a sparkling orange with a larger, rocky, yellowish IPA looking head. HUGE complete sheets of lace abound. Hot mama. Nose is orange peel, American fruity hops, pine sap and resin. Taste is very good- richer IPA feel with caramel backing huge resin and soapy bitterness. Sappy. Way, way better than I was expecting but this is essentially an IPA. Incredible presentation for 4.5%. Bonus points for an awesome session beer.
Pours clear copper. Aroma like soapy parfume. Taste slight bitter, interseting palate. Feels like it glides through the mouth.
Amber with a medium white head. malty with fruity notes. Malt, fruit and hops. Medium body with a balanced, slightly bitter finish.

Bottle, 33cl. As Op & Top. A little gusher, producing a big, off-white head that doesnt last very good. Clear, golden body with an orangey tint. Theres a light milky touch on the nose, with a plesant orange touch and some pale malts. Very effervescent, medium body and quite dry. Almost acidic. The flavor is orangey and hoppy, not very bitter, but sufficient. Not my favorite bitter, but quite nice. Far too effervescent though. 111112

Bottle.Pours cloudy golden with a huge fast dissipating off-white head. Aroma of peach, grapefruit, sugar and malt. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter with some peach and grapefruit.Medium to thin body, lively carbonation.
Orange colour and a lot of white head. Exotic fruits and honey. A good amount of hops. Its a more than decent bitter.
Tap. Clear yellow colour with a large head. Fresh citric aroma. A citric taste with a little bitterness.
En tirador y botella.Pálida,suave, refrescante.pocas aromas a lúpulo.En tirador mas  carbonatada.Un poco floja.
UPDATED: NOV 24, 2011 Molt lleugera i fàcil de beure. Molta aroma a llevat, pa. Li trobo a faltar escuma i carbònic. Per a lestiu o per a la ressaca.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2012 33cl. bottle. It pours a hazy light amber liquid with a very high pillowy white head and some good lacing. Hints of grass and exotic fruits, a little caramel. Medium bodied. Nicely made; very drinkable.

On tap at the De Molen pub. It poured a slightly hazy golden liquid with a creamy white head. Frutiy hops on the nose with citrus and oranges. Fresh taste with citrusy hops. Very nice smell but a bit to mild tase, but good for a fairly low abv beer. Nice and easy to drink.

330ml bottle from Cracked Kettle
Bottled 10 Jun 2011 - Pours orange with a massive foamy head. Aroma has notes of earthy hops, grass and herbs. Taste is quite bitter and hoppy with floral notes and hints of grass and pine. Long lasting bitter finish. Light bodied and carbonated. Okay, quite hoppy bitter.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average to large and mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and sweetish aroma, some tropical fruitiness and caramel, some citrus and grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, some caramel, some citrus and piney hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish, faint caramel, some sharp/bit soapy piney hoppyness. OK dryish bitter. Finish lacks the fruitiness and also in the finish hoppyness get bit soapy.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, København
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle from De Bierkonning, Amsterdam, Netherlands, 01.10.11 consumed at home w/c 10.10.11   Pours golden in colour with a white head. Described as a bitter I noticed when I checked to see if Id had this, mmhh... not sure that I agree with that, its a little spicy, yeasty and leaning towards a Belgian beer in my opinion though maybe it could be described as a Belgian or Dutch bitter. However it is tasty and refreshing, it is also nice to see D Molen doing something in the 4-5% range and doing it well. Another beer where my cooking exploits meant that I couldnt rate it as well as I would have liked.  A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov14  3.4
Licht oranje bier met een romige, witte schuimkraag. Geur van citrus, grapefruit, sinaasappel, licht caramel. Smaak: licht zoet, caramel, citrus, bitter hoppig. Nasmaak is hoppig.
Bottle. I believe I had an off bottle, because there was no foam at all. Hoppy smell. Flavour starts of really watery, finishes nice and hoppy. I dont believe this was the way it was meant to be.
33CL bottle shared at tasting golden color, citrussy scent and taste, quite hoppy. Easy drinkable. nice beer.

Hazy orange colour, white head. Fruity aroma, hops, apricot, citrus, orange, grapefruit. Bitter but mild flavour. Sweet fruity, malts, hops, citrus. Finish fruity.
(Bottle @ Café Jos, Nijmegen)
Cask. Orangeish with a nice creamy head. Aroma is faint fruit and hops. Flavor is bitter with some sourness in the background. Nice hoppiness. Very well rounded and refreshing beer.

Draught at Mikkellerbar. Took some time to poor due to a huge hue. Its hazy orange with a dense White head. Excotic fruit aroma, passion fruit, mango and some grape. Relativly mild bitterness, mild sweet fruits. Refreshing and well crafted
Nose is sweet grape, some grass, dense bittersweet hops, feel is mediumbroad, carb is heavy, taste is heavy mediumbitter hops, menthol, weak grass, heavy citrus

33cl bottle from Bierzwerg. Bottled in June 2010. Poured slightly hazy golden with a huge white head, lasts very long. Strong aroma of fruity hops, citrus. Flavor is hops, citrus and malt. Very bitter, long finish of apricot. Thin body, almost watery. Not as good as I hoped it to be.

12oz bottle I picked up at The Cracked Kettle.  Pours a lightly hazy, burnt orange with a thin, creamy white head.  Nice nose, citrus, oranges, grapefruit, a little soap.  Flavor is spot on, citrus zing, light caramel sweetness, leafy hops, a little metal.  Medium bodied, zesty finish.  Super drinkable, very refreshing.  Nailed this one.

330 ml bottle. From Rotterdam, the Netherlands.
Murky orange colour with big off-white head.
Strong resiny hoppy aroma with some mild fruitiness. 
Flavour is strong resiny hops with malty body. Hops slightly overdosed. Thinnish. Somewhat off the balance.
Orange murky body, big white head. Resiny fruity hops, very light maltiness on aroma. Flavour is dominated with hops, bitter and thin. Too dry and thin.

Draft.  Large off-white head, hazy amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, bread, light pineapple.  Taste is medium sweet, orange, some grapefruit, light bread.  Undercarbonated light-medium body.
Draft at Birch & Barley.  Cloudy dark orange, thick white head, solid lacing.  Aroma of pine and pineapple.  Taste is bitter pine resin.  Nice.

Citrus and grass. Poured a blonde color with a white head. Thin on the palate with a slight, pleasant, lingering bitterness. Not much in the actual flavor though. After being so impressed with de Molens toher beers Im especially disappointed in this one.

Nice and fresh scent of citrus, mandarin, yeast and grassy hops. The taste is fresh and citrus-like with a nice malt sweetness at the bottom. The aftertaste is dry with plenty of carbonation and gives the feeling of drinking champagne, or a fresh wheat beer mixed with a classic German pilsner. Tasty!

Tap, pours a nice frothy head, the aroma has a really nice hop smell too. I really liked this one, it had a nice bitterness and a great drinkability. The hops werent too heavy and they werent too overpowering, Very well balanced
On tap at De Molen. Poured hazy blonde with large head that retained. Very yeasty with upfront bitter flavours and a thinner body.
Skummar mycket. Ljust gul vätska. Ganska liten doft av frisk syrlig frukt. Väldigt bubblig i munnen, liten humlekaraktär och ganska menlös. Gissar att den borde druckits betydligt färskare.
Pours orange-tinged amber into a shaker. Off-white head with good retention. Spicy yeast aromas. Sharp yeast and lemony citrus.  Lasting citrus finish.
Bottle @ home I believe. Dark golden color, large off-white head. Smells a little spicy with hops and malts. Taste bitter, citrus, malts and lightly hops. Lively beer!

(33 cl, 2010)  Le liquide a une robe dorée foncée.  La tête mousseuse est énorme et persistante.  Une large dentelle est observée.  Le nez est très floral avec une présence fruitée intéressante : citron et pêche se choquent à de discrètes bananes mûres.  Les saveurs sont aussi très florales, disons très parfumées.  Les houblons perdent beaucoup de flaveurs citronnées.  Quelques pointes terreuses et résineuses finissent par se signaler.  Le malt est timide mais bien à sa place.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps étonnant.  Leffervescence me semble faible.  La texture légèrement huileuse.  La finale est bien mordante, encore une fois parfumée, touché par lépinette.  Agréable.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Hazy orange-golden color with nice huge long lasting white head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, spices. Taste, grapefruit bitter, spices, pine. Nice long bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber orange color with a longlasting off-white head. Has a fruity fresh hoppy citrus flavor with hints of caramel. Fruity malty hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty slightly soapy hoppy bitter finish.

Keg at BrewDog bar. Dark hazy orange with some white head. Peachy fruity nose. Fizzy. Very fizzy. Hint of caramel body but overwhelmed by dry citrus hops. Long hop finish. Not bad. Bit unbalanced, I dont get any sweetness at all.

On keg at the Brewdog bar. A cloudy blonde beer with a decent white head. Aroma of peach, caramel cheesecake, barley and some bubblegum. Flavours of peach, passion fruit and mango. Chewy mouth-feel and a nice passion fruit linger. Class!

Hazy amber colour, enormously large and fluffy head. Fruity-hoppy nose. Quite spicy, solid malty base with lots of bitter and aromatic hops. Shy citrus flavours in the very far background, resiny-earthy hops are well present throughout.
Tap at brewdog Edinburgh. Aroma is fresh citrus lemon. Creamy texture. Taste is very fresh citrus light. Bitter finish. Excellent session ale

Draft @ DeMolen, Aug 5th visit.
Orangée brumeuse, col épais crémeux blanc casse.
Arôme est houblonne rappelant ce nez de farine et de moulin allant sur le sucre impalpable. Belle touche de citron et agrumes presque pamplemousse.

Facile a boire dans le style des bitter, reste plus approchable avec une amertume moins prononcée.

Lots of cocked vegetable, especially cauliflower. Not my favorite från De Molen.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2011 Dit moet het lekkerste bier zijn met zon laag alcoholpercentage dat ik tot nog toe heb geproefd. Het smaakt vers en puur. De geur die je tegemoet komt als de dop eraf gaat verraadt al dat er iets lekkers komt. Deze ga ik voortaan drinken in plaats van pils.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2011 Bottled. Pours slightly hazy, light amber with a large off-white head. Fair lacings. Nose of yeast, grapefruit, citrus and  floral hops. Slightly sweet flavour with peach, pine and caramel notes. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Creamy texture. Ends up dry with a nice bitternes too. Classified as a bitter but tastes more like a pale ale.

Bouteille de 33cl. Brassée le 5 octobre 2010. Bière ambrée pâle avec une mousse crémeuse dès plus généreuse. Le nez est quelque peu acide (passé date) mais en dessous il y a des bananes séchées, de la poussière. La bouche est mince, pétillante sur la langue, légère et facile à boire. La levure domine le goût, il reste un peu damertume du houblon. La poussière est malheureusement aussi présent en fin de bouche.

Bottle 33cl @bierzwerg.de. A cloudy golden-amber beer with good head and lacing, nose is lemony. Aroma is malty, hopy, slightly metallic, bit watery body, finish is hopy with a nice bitterness. Expected something more malty but beer is nice anyway, just far from Bitter style, the lemony hops is a bit strange.

12oz bottle from IPB. Bottled November 2010. 

Appearance : Clear shiny pale amber with a huge foamy white head. Nice lacing.

Aroma : Yeasty and hoppy with malt. Crisp citrusy hops with floral and herbal notes. Nice and fresh.

Taste : .Yeast with bitter hops and malt. Finish quite malty with citrusy notes. Finish yeasty with nice malt. Fruity with light bitterness.

Palate : Fizzy carbonation but not harsh

Overall : Not really a bitter IMHO. More of a Belgian Pale Ale of some sort. Still nice malt yeast and hops. Nice crisp citrusy hops. Dry and refreshing finish. Nice looking. Nice stuff. Really drinkable.

Bottle.  Golden brown with a bubbly off-white foam.  Aromas are ripe pear with mellow lemon and earthy notes.  Bready yeast with marzipan and spices.  Flavours are sweet lemon with yeast and honey.  Medicinal with a dry, sweet hop finish and floral pine.  Good.

Aroma:good citrus,pine hops aroma...
Appearance:Clear gold,mega huge white head...
Flavor:good hopy flavor,grapefruit,pine hops....

Bottle from The Offie, Leicester. Orange-gold with a massive Belgian-style whip of foam held up by mad, effervescing carbonation. Bright floral aroma with lime, marmalade and pineapple notes. Well balanced flavour with good crisp citrusy hops suggesting lemon and tangerine zest over a robust, husky base. Splashes of booze and botanical spice belonging to a much stronger beer- a mildly hallucinatory Belgian Tripel. A good yeasty, jellied orange, faintly earthy vibe. Mouthfeel of orange Tango. Reminds me of Tunnels better efforts; earthy and flowery at once with a flick of ash. Pretty good, if a touch too fizzy.

Bottled. A murky dark golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma has notes of spicy hops as well as lighter notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrus fruits, hops, and chewy malt, leading to a dry and bitter finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Gut gehopfter Antrunk, in dem die Bitterkeit im ersten Moment verdeckt ist, zum Mittelteil aber deutlich hervorkommt. Etwas grasig, die Bitterkeit legt noch weiter zu, der Hopfen schwächelt aber plötzlich im Abgang. Hier trocken bitter, Zitrusnoten, die starke Karbonisierung stört. 11/12/10/8/9/9
Sample @ CBF. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are moderate hops, fruits, malt and notes of citrus. High carbonation.

Botiglia - Beer Shop - Latina
Schiuma abbondante con tonalità tendenti al verde, molto aromatica al naso, allinizio ricorda il liquido per fare le bolle di sapone, poi in bocca si trasforma in note agrumate e resinose. asciutta in bocca, amaro non molto persistente al palato

33CL bottle shared at tasting
golden color, citrussy scent and taste, quite hoppy. Easy drinkable. nice beer.

Bottle. Nice, slightly hazy amber, low carbonation, big lacing head.  Citric, slightly grassy hop aroma. Leafy and minerally/salty entry, some yeast autolysis, light fruity base, aromatic hop on top. Bit too onesisded on the citrus for my taste. medium to light body, mellow mouthfeel. Quick finish, light herbs in the aftertaste.Probably a lot better fresh - I dont think this beer will keep 5 years as it says on the bottle.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 140511.
Orange with white head. Aroma of fruit and citrus. Flavor with malt, spices and esters

Golden blonde, dense white head. Aroma of lemon, pepper, spices, some cinnamon. taste is slightly bitter, somewhat dry, like bread or crackers. Medium to long finish, reasonable bitter. Nice, and full bodied with a low Abv. Good.

Bottled @ tasting cgarvieuk, courtesy of BeerCast_Rich. Hazy dark yellow colour, white head. Aroma is citrus and fruits. Flavour is bitter, citrus, fairly carbonated. Fairly bitter finish. Well drinkable.

[330ml bottle, The Bottle Shop, Canterbury] Hazy gold pour, with a big white head. Slightly wheaty aroma, some hops and faint malty notes. Pretty thin and lagerish. Golden aley even. Some hop presence and woody notes on the palate. Underwhelmed by this one [08052011]

7 May 2011, bottle at one of cgarvieuks legendary tastings. really pale yellow, almost totally clear, rocky head. big and yeasty and for some reason it reminds me of sunflowers. med body and slightly fizzy. slight citrus hops, some yeast, surprisingly some alcohol, and something like honeysuckle or some other fruit.
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2011 bottle at home ... thanks to Richard ... light hazy amber ... light fruity orange hop .. soft hop  nose ... light smokey hoppy front ... juicy hop ... soft fruits ...
Bottle a dark golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruit spicy and hops flavor malts citrus fruits some spicy and a bitter hop finish

Bottle. Pours a hazy, deep honey-hued orange with a big, creamy, long-lasting head. Wonderful looks on this one. Aroma is nuts, pale malts and hints of hay and honey melon. Taste is oats, grassy hops with hints of honey melon and something original enough for me to be unable to put my finger on it. Fresh and thirst-quenching mouthfeel, Id have a liter of this as a session ale any day. A very nice little bitter from De Molen.

Bottle. 
Very earthy hop aroma, grass, dry fruits, citrus. Orange-amber-borwn with a low, fine head and cloudy. Dry, earthy flavor, light caramel malt, metal, grass, peach, and a bit of citrus. Retrained and light, though with a nicely bitter finish. Funky, earthy yeast and hop combo reminds me of the Nagahama beers made nearby Shiga! Refshing but a bit harsh and less than memorable.
Probably the only disappointment Ive had from De Molen. Lemon citrus, wood and loads of pine/grass come through on both the nose and taste. Not my preferred style I guess

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2012 Delicious looking beer; cloudy copper with big head. Very fragrant with blood orange, pepeach, dough, lychee and spices such as cardemon.  Full of flavour, balances sweet and bitter first making it very drinkable. More bitter in the middle. Very recently priced. (33cl bottle) (Rating re-indexed)

Bottle. Pours a very hazy amber with huge rocky bright white head. Aromas are full of fruit with lots of citrus coming through. Light caramel in support. Flavour is very bitter with some light fruit sweetness in the background. Very lively carbonation with medium mouthfeel. Not my favourite from these guys.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured yellow with a white head.  aroma was lemon citrus and orange.  flavor was lemon and pine with a light and fizzy body.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2011 Orange yellow beer with a big and blond head. Aroma is quite mild, tropical fruits, peaches. Taste is quite bitter, some fruits, also tropial fruits, woodyness and drying aftertaste. Quite light to drink with quite high carbonation. Light and enjoyable beer with nice tropical fruity and refreshness.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2011 33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, golden color with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, yeast and some malt. Dry taste with medium bitterness. Quite balanced. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Nothing really outstanding.

On tap at The Rake, London. Pours a hazy golden orange, with a thick off white head. This beer was packed full of aromas and tastes, almost seemed like they were trying to put too much in. Orange, lychee, sweet caramel, toffee, sour esters, rockmelon and mandarin. Was quite thick, and decently bitter.
Hazy golden with a white head. Fruity, spicy and malty aroma with herbal and grassy notes. Bitter and alcoholic with a dry palate leaning to astringent. Medium body. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2012 Re rated, bottel thx to Enjoyit cons 2011-12-15 Göteborg
New rating: 3,5 keep average, this one was more fizzy!


Wee bottle from SB cons 2011-03-30 Göteborg
AR: wild strawberries, fresh apricot
AP: pilzner colored body, bone white fluffy head
F: grape fruit, dryness, some apricots, heavy pine. But the dryness is the most evident part of the story...

330ml bottle, 2010-07-01 bottling. Pours medium straw, slight haze, white head. Malty, very hoppy nose, earthy undertones, citrus peel, hay, herbs. Light to medium body, dry, balanced bitterness. Malty, hoppy, spicy taste, notes of grapefruit, pineapple, earth. (2011-03-16)

Its hazy, dark golden with a creamy head, and the aroma has notes of malt and flower. Sadly the mouth-feel is very fizzy. The flavour is refreshing with notes of malt, flower, citrus, and the finish is dry and slightly bitter.
Bottle, kindly shared by abemorsten. Pours golden with thin head. Prominent bittering hops with some malt sweetness. Bitter finish.
Bottle. Yellow haze with large white head. Grass, malt, sticky carbon dioxide. Citrus. Dry malt. Medium body. Not bad but not my style.
nose of grassy hops, black currants, wine gums and slight puke. taste is chalky, stoney, crispy and very refreshing. excellent smooth mouthfeel, as always from de molen

330 ml bottle served in a wine-tasting glass. Off-white 2" head that reduces to 1/2", cloudy yellow-amber body. Nose: Citrus, white asparges  and perfume.
Taste: White asparges, citrus, cooked vegetables an a small hint of grapefruit. Short semi-dry after-taste with some hops.
330ml Bottle (Tack Nina :) ) - Amber in colour. Tea, peach and grapefruit in the aroma. Hoppy taste with toffee, peach and a slight sweetness.
Draught at the ACBF 2011. Golden in the glass, nice head, fruity aroma, modest sweet. Starts dry, quite mild, dry-fruity. Finish a bit moldy, dry. Not my favourite.

Aroma: fruity pineapple, but incredible weak. 
Appearance: hazy amber colour, big bubbly off-white head that makes me think of washing-up liquid.
Flavour: And the taste is washing-up liquid diluted with water, drain pour. 
Mouthfeel: incredible watery. 
Total: My first from De Molen and what a disappointment, worst beer Ive had this year.

Medium hazy orange with a medium sized white head. Earthy cellar aroma with some peach and other fruit to it, and also a medium maltiness The mouth goes along the same line but is a bit thin with a medium bitter ending.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy golden. Large white.
Flowery, goppy, fruity aroma; apricos and pine-apple.
Pretty light body and light to medium bitterness.
A bit unbalanced, harsh bitterness.
Some fruity hoppiness.

last beer of the night at in de wildeman .. . clean and simple .. . a great session, enough hops for a hophead .. . caramel and resin .. . light citrus also .. . just fantastic! .. . go with the venetian blinds..

Bottle at home and draught at Monks Porterhouse.
Pours solid golden with a pillowy head.
Very pleasant cross between a APA and a UK bitter
Bottled:Pours a hazy, pale amber colour with a dense head. Hoppy aroma of nettles, lychees and gooseberries. Hoppy flavour of resin, pine and tropical fruit. Pretty good!

Bottle. Had it two times now from this Systembolaget release. First time was more positive with aroma notes of caramel, fruit candy, cookie dough, orange peel and light floery hops. Taste was malty and light sweet with slight notes of yeast, cookie dough, orange peel, bread which rose to a woody dry bitterness. Body was fairly week withouth getting watery and carbonation was light and tickeling.
Then I tried it a second time and I got some of these things but they were clearly overpowered by a strong cooked vedgetable note. I see now that more swedish people have felt the same. Something wrong here?

Bottle, brewed Dec 2010. Light amber, slightly hazy, with a white head leaving lacing. Aroma: quity hoppy: tropical fruits (pineapple?), berries, elderberry, toffee and a hint of chick peas. Taste: toffee, chick pea-ish malt, grape, citrus, pineapple, elderberries and perhaps some other berries, medium bitter. Medium-bodied, almost moussy. Pretty nice.

Hazy golden color, mediumsized white head. Aroma is lightly fruity, but also with some notes of cooked vegetables, bread, and herbs. Flavour is lightly bready with some hints of citrus, herbs but also the cooked vegetables found in the aroma, and green apples, and a harsch bitterness. Lightbodied with high carbonation. No, not good - must be something wrong here.
Aroma is begian yeast, some beta acid hops with orange notes, maybe some pine trees. Taste is rather flat with moderate bitterness, not really the taste expected from aroma.

(Bottle) Pours cloudy dark orange with an off-white head. The aroma is strange with notes of vegetables and oranges up front. Bready malt base alongside a note of spicy Belgo yeast - white pepper and mild nutmeg. Quite unclean on the nose. The flavour is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Tones of citrus, herbs, vegetables, yeast, and light malt. Maybe a whisper of cinnamon. The mouthfeel is watery with light to medium carbonation. Light citric and pale malty finish. Light bodied.
Horrible cooked cauliflower aroma. Surely something must be wrong here? Otherwise, a somewhat bland taste with a touch of those cauliflowers and some hoppy notes. Small-to-medium body.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
High lasting thick beige foam and litle clowdy golden color.
Fruity almost like fruit PEZ tablets aroma.
Huge bitterness with loads of hop taste but too much but close. The body is also very big for such a low alcohole beer.  One of the few bad things of this beer is that for a bitter it doesnt have a big drinkabillity as it is so loaded with taste.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Hoppy aroma, unclean malt character with notes of cauliflower. Light body, medium carbonation. Dry with fairly high and a bit harsh bitterness which feels more like 50 than 30 IBU.

Bottle. Hazy dark golden colour with a white head. Fruity hops, citrus, apricots, apples, some bread, lightly acidic. Too much carbonation and a bit harsh mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Tastes like a half decent homebrew.

Bottle, kindly shared by abemorsten. ABv is 4.5%. Golden colour, hazy at the end of the bottle. Moderate white head. Very nice aroma of fruity hops. Distinct hoppy flavour throughout, feels more bitter than its 30.4 EBU. Could use a little more malts for balance, but is very nice as it is.

Bottle 0,33ltr: One of the lower in alcohol of the Molen Brewery, mostly i used to drink higher ones 9% and higher. But this 4,5% hazy orange coloured one with an great bitter taste, is just great too. An true Dutch Bitter from Bodegraven.

Draught at Monks, Sveavägen, Stockholm. Somewhat hazy yellow beer with a small white head. Bready and fruity aroma with grassy and citrus notes. Hoppy flavor, grassy, fruity notes and some metal. Easy to drink.
Courtesy of bu11zeye. hazy dark golden color/ ivory head. Pale malt, floral, caramel aromas. medium bodied. Pale malt, grainy caramel flavors with mild earthy hoppage.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle. Hazy amber/orange with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit and hops.
2011 - 02 - 01 330ml bottle hazy yellow colour. big white fading head. grassy sur smell. bit earthy taste. nice beer ...

Bottle 330ml. @ home.Clear medium orange color with a huge - gusher, frothy - fizzy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, fruity, moderate hoppy, dusty, moderate yeasty, wood, exotic wood - fruit, light leather. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long long duration, dusty, light metalic. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light metalic. IMO: Not harmoniously as anormal beer from De Molen, but still easy to drink ;O) [20110122]

11.2 oz bottle shared by jtclockwork, thanks James. Poured a clear orange body with a bunch of large clinging bubbles and a super huge foamy white head. Aroma of yeast, barley, hint of rye, bready and lemon zest. Thin body but not overly watery, soft carbonation and a foamy finish. The flavor is flatter then the aroma made up of mostly bread crusts and a hint of smoke. Solid especially for a 4.5%er.

Thanks to JTclockwork for sharing this one. Pours out a moderately cloudy copper color with a nice foamy slightly off white head. Aroma is of some biscuit and grainy malts, with light hop. Taste is strange, some odd plastic notes, some hops, and some grainy cereal malts in there also.
Bottle shared at Dmacs tasting. Pours amber brown with off white head. Nose of very bready corn chips, rye, yeast and barley. Tastes like a yeasty rye bread. Not much bitterness. Mostly grains.

Uncontrolable and excessive foaming,. Impermeable color - somewhere between amber and chestnut-brown, but not a pretty beer (EBC 22). The scent is hoppy and fresh - apricots, citrus fruit, maybe a little apple.
 Fresh and light taste of citrus and summer and a bit of caramel. as well Surprisingly long finish with an equally surprising bitter mouthfeel - the bottle says just 30 IBU. Anyway, its a good, refreshing beer. And its much better in taste than its appearance suggests.

Bottle @ De Molen. Pours beatiful clear copper with a huge fluffy off white head leaving nice lacing. Good carbonation. Aroma of caramel, malts, hops, fruity, citrus and perry. Crispy fruity mouthfeel. Flavor is hoppy piny, fruity, citric. Crispy fruity palate. Finishes shortlived bitter hoppy.

(Bottle, 0.33 l, at Pikkulintu) The beer poured brown orange and cloudy. Its head was huge and white. Aroma had Belgian style yeast, citricness and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation, Flavours were Belgian style yeast, fruitiness, sweetness, malts, hops, citricness and bitterness. Aftertaste was yeasty and bitter. I wouldnt call this a bitter. A decent beer but completely missing the style.

(33cl bottle brewed July 1 2010, bottled July 29, 2010 thanks to bu11zeye) opaque golden, lasting film of fine white bubbles. Nose of celery, butter, cinnamon, cilantro and cotton candy. Taste of bitter citrus peel, earth, cracker and a bit of umami. Oily body, soft carbonation.
Bottle at St Albans BF 2010.  Slightly earthy English hop.  Earthy, decent hop.  Earthy lightish beer.

On tap @ In De Wildeman. Quite cloudy, so the color seemed copper or orange, a bit hard to tell. Aromas of sweet fruit and lots of hops (bitter, resin). Flavor is bitter but very drinkable. Quite some body for a "low" alcoholic beer. Nice flavorful thirstquencher.

330ml Bottle (Brewed 7/1/10.  Bottled 7/29/10.):  Bitter aroma of malt, hops, grains, slight caramel, and minerals.  Poured orange/amber in color with a large, loose, head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Tastes of malt, hops, wood, grains, light yeast, light pine, slight grass.  Medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Medium bitter, lightly sweet, hop, malt, grain, light yeast, and wood finish.  Very flavorful for 4.5%ABV.

(33cl bottle)  Pours a hazy yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of mustiness, orange, perfume, pine, and nuts.  Flavor of grass, herbs, caramel, florals, and citrus with a dry, bitter finish.

Hazy dark yellow colour. Not big head. Bitter smell, lots of hops expected. Taste is bitter, perhaps even really bitter, but not annoying. Aromas is mostly cereal and citrus with over yeasty dough. Not my great favourite.

Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. 
The beer pours a yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is grassy hops, apples and grain. The flavor is a mix of apples and lemons, as well as some grassy, grain and wheat. Low bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Pretty good overall.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  Poured a clear golden body with a lasting off-white, sticky head.  Aromas of light floral hops and mild caramel sweetness.  Flavors of light grassy/floral hops, some malt sweetness.

Quite normal. Orange with an average white head. Aroma is fruity (orange, grapefruit), malty, with some honey hints. Taste is lightly sweet with a good bitterness. I didnt find it so exceptional. A nice one, but not the best of De Molens production.

(Draught at Monks Café Wallingatan, Stockholm) Reddish amber colour with huge, frothy, beige head. Malty, slightly fruity nose with toast, orange peel and crystal malt. Draught at Monks Café Walingatan, Stockholm.  Clear amber, mid sized head. Minerally nose. Dry andligyt bodied with clean mouthfeel. Heavily chalky, floral and quite bitter, Slight caramel and bitter orange. More like a rustic rural Argentinian microbrew than a de Molen.

Som hade en gulgrumlig färg, stort skum och doftade mycket frukt.
Smaken var som en frisk och fruktig pilsner med en liten brödig eftersmak.

On tap at De Molen in Bodegraven. November 2010. 

Hazy orange with a nice large white head. Nice fruity aroma. Pleasant taste of fruit, malt, grass. Medium carbonation with a good mouth feel and pleasant bitterness.

330ml bottle brought back home from Barley Wine in Copenhagen and shared with Finn. Huge, rocky white head. Cloudy, dark orange coloured body. Hoppy smell mixed with semi-sweet malts. Taste of sappy fruits season with a kind of spiced chocolate malt and followed by a nice, plain bitter ending (Tromsø, 17.11.2010).

Flaske 0,33l påspandert av Rune og delt med ham i WC-veien 17 Nov 11. Appelsinfarget. Litt uklar. Kjempehøyt kremaktig skum. God syrlig fruktaroma. Rik fruktig smak med en syrlig avslutning. Utmerket øl.
Bottle from Købmandsgården, Hammel. Pours hazy golden with a huge rocky white head.Sweet fruity aroma.Taste is bitter fruity, turns even more bitter towards the end, fascinating beer this.

A Mes rate. Bottle thanks to Ian.Slightly hazy gold with a thin but lasting white head. Really enjoyable perfumed and aromatic aroma. Similar flavour but the hops make it a little soapy. Good bitter finish rounds things off nicely. A straight forward but enjoyable and aromatic Dutch version of a very English style. Nice.
bottle, via trade with koelschtrinker, muddy brown orange color with lots of bubbly foam, aroma is dry apricots,  bitter, flavors of nice bitter oranges, chalky, sour, minerally finish

Bottle. High fluffy agressive long lasting white head. Hazy peach coloured body. Powerful fruity hops hay aroma. Hops alcohol dominated bitter pine fruit flavor with low carbonatin and a long dry nutty spicy aftertaste.

Hazey golden-brown with a superb pillowy off-white head.  Mild malty aroma. Nice body, starts off slightly earthy roasty-smokey then fades to a more traditional bitter flavor but has a nice hop finish.

Bottle 33cl. Hazy honey colour, big head with large bubbles that disappear quickly. Smells of citrus fruits (grapefruit) and hints of pine needles. Also something of a stale smell, a bit like musty barley. 
Excellent use of hops, lovely bitterness. Quite aggressive carbonation.  Amazing body if you consider the ABV. Some nice light citrus fruit sourness. The finish is a rather simple and medium bitter. If tasted blindfolded I would have put a lot of money on this being a >5% beer.

Bottle:
Big white airy head on top of a clear orange beer.
Smell is a delcious mix of hops, flowers, fruit(citrus, lemon, orange), sweets and a slight hint of malts. Taste is very light but with a good fruity and hoppy taste.
The hoppy fruity taste keeps rolling in your mouth with a good bitterness and light dryness.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: from www.erzbierschof.ch - cloudy dark orange colour with a hugely foamy beige head; nice lace; a fair hoppy aroma with notes of apples and honey; bitter oranges; astringent and medium-bodied, very high carbonation; bitter and dry with a long aftertaste of bitter oranges and fresh cream - fresh

bottle, kindly delivered by Bierkoning - Cheers! Hazy amber colour, enormously large and fluffy head. Fruity-hoppy nose. Quite spicy, solid malty base with lots of bitter and aromatic hops. Shy citrus flavours in the very far background, resiny-earthy hops are well present throughout. Very high carbonation.

Very strong carbonation gassy misty dark amber pour aroma fruit caramel pine floral flavour pine resinous strong ibu decent grapefruit apricot sweet malt caramel has some fizz finish good alround hop tastethe main giving a real aftertaste of fruit and bitter goodness

Bottle. Very cloudy gold with a ridiculously huge cream head that collapses to look like a scummy sea after a storm. Fruity aroma with pears, peaches and grapefruit. Very fizzy mouthfeel. Light fruity malts with nothing in the way of caramel or toffee. Prominent drying bitterness with distinct US accents - pine and grapefruit. After a lot of swirling and waiting, something thats a bitter emerges and its OK if a little watery and crudely hopped.

on tap.come al solito de molen non sbaglia un colpo.delicata nei profumi floreali e speziati,abb. persistente.inbocca gradevole legermente fruttata con note speziate, finale legermente amarognolo.equlibrata.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2011 RE tried this recently & was really impressed, the 1st time I had it it seemed a bit muted & dare I say bland, but the last one I had was spot on.  Lovely little cross between an English style light golden beer & a US IPA.  If you want a session beer with loads of flavour look no furthur, this is spot on.

Bottle from Ølbutikken. Pours cloudy, ruddy brown with a medium head. Fruity and somewhat sweet aroma. Hints of perfume. Notes of chocolate flavours, but actually very bitter in the mouth. Some fruitiness. Interesting and highly drinkable.

Bottled 330ml (bottled 25062010)
Thanks bierkoning! Hazy orange color, huge fluffy white head. Peachy and piney hoppy nose, not very strong, also a bit yeasty. Light body. Very crisp carbonation. Piney hoppyness, dry woody-grainy flavor, lingering bitterness. Ok bitter, not just very exiciting De Molen.

Bottled. Orangeish amber colour, mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is fruity and floral hoppy along with some grassy and spicy notes. Flavour is sweet malts, some yeast, quite spicy and grassy. Not a very cleantasting bitter, but I can see the idea of a bitter in this.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with HUGE white head. Carbonation might be a bit off. Lots and lots of pine and resin on the nose with a hint of malt and citrus hops. The palate is dominated by MASSIVE hop bitterness which is quite harsh. Very, very dry. This is very good, but the harsh bitterness and excessive carbonation bring it down a bit.
Good size fluffy white head on a slightly hazy golden body. I like the aroma, piney citrusy hoppy aroma. Good bitterness, medium body, dry, mainly hops in the taste and very easy to drink.

Bottle, 4.5%. Very big head, seems overcarbonated. Nice and pleasant, sweet and fruity hop aroma. Cloudy dark orange colour. The flavour has some of the same fruitiness as the aroma along with a distinct bitterness, clean and cleansing. Also a distinct yeast note in the finish.

Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy great grassy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long great wonderfull heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2010 [9/28/10] Bottle at a friends place in Amsterdam. Golden with a big white head. Pleasant citrusy aroma. Bitter hoppy flavor with grapefruit and some balancing malt sweetness. Medium-bodied. Very enjoyable and highly drinkable.

Bottled.  A chill hazed gold coloured beer with a big spongey white head.  A good US piney hoppy aroma with a touch of sweetish malts.  Nice light lemony hops in the mouth.  Quite APA like.  Tasty and in no way extreme.

Pours out slightly hazy orange/blonde, wild white head, nice conditioning Light citrus aroma with subtle bread, lemon, yeast touch of soapiness (not in a bad way.) On to the flavour, not all that much to speak of unfortunately. Its fresh and delicate with floral notes, citrus, grassiness and is nicely balnced, though it does suffer from being a bit watery in the mids to finish, as in actually tasting water and also it just seems to lack any depth. I know De Molen can produce well flavoured beers at lower abv, look at Engels for instance. This just doesnt succeed in the same way. Sure on a hot day this would go down a treat as a cold beer to glug, but other than that theres not a whole lot going on. De Molen rock as brewery and I love that Menno experiments, sometimes you just have to the the rough with the smooth.

Botella en casa. Hazy deep amber colour. Big well lasting white bubbly steady off-whiteish head leaving a good lacing. Pleasant hoppy piney fruitish hoppy  aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is dry and bitter, not so so fruity, pine, pleasantly fresh.
bottled. hark hazy orange. light head, off-white. the aroma is full of flowers, roses, bacon. very sparkling. the taste is a wonderful, especially ially the bitter aftertaste

Bottled. Amber coloured. Unclear. Beige head. Aroma of flowers, herbs, spice, vague caramel. Flavour of caramel, soap, flowers, spice, sweetness and citrus. Medium bodied. Dry citric bitterness in the end. For the ABV this is a quite delicious IPA, which I could drink regularily.

330 ml bottle @ home. Brewed 20.5.2010, bottled 25.6.2010.
Pours a slightly hazy orange colour with a massive foamy head. Hard to pour. Aroma of fresh hops, caramel with some fruitiness and grass. The taste is nicely hopped with notes of citrus, grass and some spices. Fruity and dry finish. Light/medium bodied, oily to slicky mouthfeel with decent carbonation. Very nice low-ABV IPA.

Served into a Flying dog pint glass

A: Amber with a massive head.

S: Peach, bitter hops, soapy.

T: Peach, bitter, light and a little bit watery, crisp medium carbonation.

Overall a good beer just nice for a session beer at 4.5%, not much complexity reminds me a little bit of Amarillo beer from de Molen as well (they both use Amarillo hops)

Bottle. Orange blonde. The beer foams like a mad dog, makes pouring it into a glass difficult. Cascade aroma. Grapefruit, almost soapy. Firm hopbitter flavor with grapefruit, melon and earthy notes. Thin, just a bit soapy finish.

Bottle from De Molen. Like expected, another great IPA from this brewery. Dark orange/light brown pour with a huge white head. Head stays there for a long time. Great aroma with the typical IPA hints like grapefruit, hops and some lemon. Full body with a refreshing hoppy finish. Great, refreshing brew especially for the low ABV.

pours a clear orange,huge offwhite head
aroma is flowery, hoppy , mild.
flavor is very hoppy, bitter, flowery, faint sweet malty. hop-bomb @4.5%

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Dusty hoppy aroma with notes of citrus.and light spices. The flavour is quite dry with notes of pine and light caramel. Light spicy hoppy finish. Nice session beer.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2011 Bottle at home.
Hazy orange coloured with a huge off-white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of yeast and grass.
Fruity flavour of hops and pine needles with notes of yeast and grass.
Dry hoppy finish.
Nice hop profile, but too much yeast.
7-3-7-3-14

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear amber/brown with a huge white head and an aroma of grassy hops, citrus, orange peel and pine. The taste is mildly sweet in the beginning with hints of fruit, mainly citrus, and malts. Very quick a big hoppy bitterness comes kicking in. A really nice beer for the low abv.

Bottle. Pours an unclear and amber beer with a large offwhite head. The aroma is weak with malt and hops with citrus. The flavor is likewise malt and hops with citrus. The palate is bitterness. Overall this is just above average.

Pours orange, large foamy head.
Quite fruity in the nose, i feel something metallic in it. 
light body, much warm for the 4.5%.
it seems more bitter than the 30 ibus.
Hoppy drinkable.
Pours golden with a large white head. Aroma is malt, light peach and citrus. Flavour is malt, peach and citrus. High bitter.

(Bottled) Clear amber with a large, big-bubbly head. Aroma of fresh hay and grass, and some exotic fruitiness. Flavor is lightly sweet, very fruity, but also bitter with a nice grassy-herby character and lightly caramely malt. Very slight grainy harshness, typical to low-ABV IPAs is present, but not disturbingly so. Medium body, slightly foamy carbonation, quite refreshing. This was actually a quite nice and fruity-aromatic "Finnish supermarket IPA". 5535
Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Cloudy amber - white head. Bitterness. Grassy. Fruity. Dryness. Cactus. Piney. Soapy. Ok.

Bottle at home. Pours out orange, with a medium good holding white head. Spiced and hoppy smell. Pepper inside, good spiced. Taste is about the same, hoppy, biterness, some spices and citrus. Good drinkeable, but nothing really interesting.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 Sample beer at a presentation by Menno at wortwat evening. Late hopped beer of 4.5%. Nice beer not too bitter.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2010 A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy off white head. The aroma of hops with strong sweet fruits. There are malts. The taste of some hop bitter, hints of vailla and sweet fruits. The aftertaste of sweet with bitter,
Hazy orange with a large off white head. Hoppy nose with grapefruit and pine. Hoppy flavor with pine, grapefruit and yeasty hints. Finished dry and bitter.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge off-white head. Aroma is peachy and distinct grapefruity hoppy. Fruity and peachy. Lingering yeasty and hops fruity into a dry and crisp fruity finish.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a cloudy opaque amber with a huge and lively off-white head. Citrusy hop aroma. Medium body, overcarbonated, dry and leathery with a harsh biterness. A little rough. 250810

Head fast reduced to off-white rim, over veiled orange-ochre beer. Muscatgrapes, USA hops, dry Hessian hopsacks. Very UK-bitter like, very authentic, even. The hops still there, but presenting themselves more UK-like. Just the little muscatgrape flavour tells about Amarillo/Cascade. Light, refreshing, near astringent in the aftertaste. Very good: making UK bitter with USA hops, in the lowlands of Holland.

Bottle: Deep golden, hazy, huge loose, very stable, off-white head with a good lacework; very solid lemony and piney hops with a light malty and fruity background; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour, not too dry; light to medium bodied, soft; inevitable lingering dry piney finish. Superb brew....
Light amber color, thick compact head. Nice citrus aroma. Just a bit of an earthy taste but that gets overwhelmed by the citrus of the hops. Very nice beer, and just 4,5%.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2011 Huge white foamy head. Bitterness of grapefruit and a little tangering. a 4.5 IPA, kinda special. Bitterness sets in a little too quick and overwhelmes the taste. Is it really 30.4 EBU?

Bottle @ home. The aroma has grapefruits, melons, some malts. Quite full. Hazy-cloudy, brown coloured beer with an off-white, big foamy head. The taste is bitter, has a lot fruity hops and there is some caramel present. Good body, especially compared to the alcohol content. Great beer for the summer days.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2012 Bottle/Draft @ home/bars/de molen/everywhere. Deep hazy amberish orange, large tanned head.Aroma of fruity amarillo and herbal czech hops, some yeast and some spices. Flavour is medium dry bitterness with fruits, yeast, malt, spices, some earthy sidenotes. Very full for the abv, holds up after the biggest stouts. Once a favorite session beer.

Bottled. Cloudy orange brown color, huge off-white head. Great hop combination in aroma, with the typical grapefruity notes of cascade and amarillo. Slight spicy hint. Decent bitter taste, crisp and pretty clean for as far as I did pour most of the yeast in the glass. Soft IPA and only 4.5%, but very elegant in its simplicity.

(bottle, 33cl) Cloudy, deep golden to light-amber colour with a huge and rocky, slightly tanned foamy head. Fruity and piney hoppy aroma with notes of grapefruit, lemon and mildly sweet and yeasty malty background. Moderately bitter and slightly sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Soft malty base with a rich noble hoppy blend; dry and bitter-sweet fruity, piney and zesty hoppy finish. 11.VIII.10

Bottle. [thank you, Feldthaus]
Pours hazy orange with a big, frothy, white head. Aroma is heavy fruity. Melons, grapefruit, lots of peach, light resiny, light grassy. Medium to high carbonation, good dry mouthfeel. Flavour has yeast, resiny, piney and light fruity hops. Lots of bitterness. Some crisp maltiness. Actually quite fine, even if it is a tad too carbonated and there still is that yeast present, which probably shouldnt be there.

On tap at Haarlem Culinair. Hazy light amber colour, dense slightly off white head. Aroma of pine and grassy hops, light citrus. Flavour is light sweet, orange, but mostly bitter hops, pine, light grassy, very dry bitter finish. Light bodied. Very refreshing.
33cl, new Dutch brew Anno 2010, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, yet easy to drink, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2011 Bottle at home. Hazy dark orange to brown color with an extremely huge foamy white head that leaves lacing. Aroma of grassy, floral hops with some pine and resin. Flavor is bitter, fruity, nice and hoppy with pine, grapefruit and grass. Creamy texture and very lively carbonation. Great brew, especially for the low ABV.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2011 Thnx Molenbrouwer. Hazy amber colored brew. Aroma of grassy hops, some exotic fruits. Nice dry bitterness and grassy hops in the flavor. Good mild hopped aftertaste. Full flavored. Especially nice when you keep in mind the low alcoholpercentage. A job well done.At ACBF 2011:Galena: Nice hop, mild bitter and smooth. 
Cascade: Medium bitter, also nice hopped :)
Bottle from Bierkoning. Nice amber body with lasting head. Nice hoppy and pine nose. Taste of hops and pines. Quite nice. Smooth texture and lasting. Enjoyable.
